story:
ENGLISH: 
I was accepted to an artist residency in Biella, Italy, in an institution called Cittadellarte - UNIDEE (University of Ideas). I am doing this crowdfunding to gather money for the tuition and the plane ticket so I can go! Whoever appreciates my work (and/or simply myself) and would like to contribute with any amount possible, I will be forever thankful!
The tuition includes home and board, but it costs 570 euros (today at USD$ 638,09!) and the plane ticket 136 euros, which is a lot for my budget... 
       Any help is welcome, for it will minimize the impact of putting out all this money, but which is, after all, a great investment in my career and an incredible opportunity. Thanks a lot for any and every kind of help <3

If you wanna look at some of my art works so far, see: http://dandaracatete.wix.com/arte


PORTUGUÊS: 
Eu fui aceita para uma residência artística em Biella, Itália, em uma instituição chamada Cittadellarte - UNIDEE (University of Ideas). Estou arrecadando dinheiro para pagar a taxa de inscrição e o bilhete de avião para poder ir! Quem aprecia meu trabalho (e/ou a minha pessoa) e gostaria de contribuir com a quantia que seja possível, eu estarei para sempre agradecida! 
A taxa de inscrição compreende estadia e comida, mas custa 570 euros (hoje a R$2494,25!!!), e o bilhete 136 euros, o que é muito caro para o meu orçamento... 
       Qualquer ajuda é ótimo, pois minimizará o impacto que é desembolsar toda essa grana, mas que afinal, é um grande investimento na minha carreira e uma oportunidade incrível. Muito obrigada desde já por toda e qualquer ajuda que possam oferecer <3

LEMBRETE IMPORTANTE: A vaquinha está em DÓLARES! Verifique a taxa de câmbio para evitar surpresas desagradáveis ;)

Se quiser dar uma olhada nos meus trabalhos, entre em: http://dandaracatete.wix.com/arte

story:
In an ideal world I would have a housemate paying rent to cover living expenses. Unfortunately, my search for a housemate is taking far longer than anticipated and I have run out of options. Please help me get through just a little bit longer so I can keep the house running. 

 

I'm asking for help paying the following expenses:

  • Power, $160
  • Internet, $80
  • Insurance (car/renters), $70
  • License plate registration, $100
  • Medication for Mister, $90
Any little bit will help. Thank you.

story:
EUREKA!

·It means ‘I have found it!’

·It was shouted by Archimedes when he solved a vexing problem.

·It is the ‘ah ha!’ moment that artists and scientists experience when things come together in just the right way….

And, it is the theme of the 3rd annual exhibition brought to you by Art for All Spaces!

About our Project

Art for All Spaces is inviting you to be part of this special showing which celebrates that magical moment when art and science collide.  The thrill of discovery will prevail on March 17, 2016 at the City Arts Factory in Orlando, Florida as participating artists show works that are informed by or inspired by science and the natural world.  Works by local artists as well as students from the graduating art class at Lake Highland Preparatory School will be on display, along with brief narratives (written by the artists) highlighting their interpretations of the theme.  As with previous Art for All Spaces events, the opening reception of Eureka! will be followed by a special secondary opening featuring talks by guest speakers from the scientific community. 

What we need:

Art for All Spaces is seeking to raise $3,000 in contributions to produce this exhibit.  Major expenses include rental of gallery space, payment to gallery assistants to install the show, payment to guest speakers, catering, production of postcards, marketing and other miscellaneous costs.You can contribute any amount from $5.00 and up to help our project.

Our Focus

Art for All Spaces produces quality exhibits that focus not only on visual appeal and revenue generation but also on education, learning, dialogue and interaction. 

Our Track Record

In 2013, Art for All Spaces brought I Believe to the City Arts Factory, an extraordinary exhibit pairing poetry with visual art and featuring a viewer’s choice award.   In 2014, we hosted Reviving the Ancients at the City Arts Factory, featuring an array of new work by local artists along with interpretive talks by three guest speakers from local colleges and universities at the secondary opening.  These shows were made possible by the generous support of sponsors who believe in our mission.  Please feel free to browse our 'gallery' to see images from these events.

How You Can Help

Our goal is to offer professional, emerging and student artists the opportunity to exhibit work incorporating science and the natural world, and to produce a one-of-a-kind educational exhibit that promotes community learning, dialogue and exchange.   You can help us accomplish our goal by making a contribution.  The success of this campaign depends on many small contributions. You can also help by sharing this campaign with others who love the arts and want to help make Eureka! a reality.  Thank you!

story:
What is Lusio. A Night to Awaken?

Lusio. A Night to Awaken is a one night only, free, family friendly event where 30+ light art exhibits are set throughout 18 acres of Volunteer Park for all to explore. 
Lusio is not just a celebration and festival of light and sound; Lusio is a chance to playfully explore a delicate and fleeting art form curated directly into the lush nature of the Pacific Northwest. Thousands of people flock to the historic park for a magical evening unlike any other in Seattle. Be part of the magic and help us by donating a few dollars. 

Relax - Wonder - Wander - Play - Explore 
 

Why Lusio? ​

To provide an opportunity for light artists to have their work shown in a public setting. 

Lusio provides artists the opportunity to get their work seen and voices heard by a wide demographic of people in curated but playful setting. 

Most light art is shown in a gallery, at a festival, or at a private event. Rarely does this form of art get a real chance to be seen by the public eyes of Seattle and never has it been showcased in such a large setting before Lusio.

Lusio is a free family friendly event making it available to any person of any demographic that wants to attend and have their senses delighted and inspired. Because art should be accessible to everyone! 

To Spread Happiness in Bulk.  To Engage. To Play!

To quote Heraclitus, "Lifetime is a child at play, moving pieces in a game. Kingship belongs to the child." With all the advances in technology that make this type of art possible, it's easy to forget technology and art can also be playful. 

Playfulness has been proven to decrease stress, improve brain function, stimulate creativity, promote connections, improve social skills, and positive well being. 


Funding Lusio
Lusio is not a quick pop up exhibit. Lusio takes almost the full year to plan and execute properly + thousands of volunteer hours.  
Most of the funding comes from the pockets of the artists and Lusio curator. Last year it cost approximately $11,000 to produce the annual festival and we did it with less than $3,000 in community donations. The artists and curator spend quite a lot of their own money funding these installations, many of which are created just for Lusio!

Our goal is to raise at least $3000 to give stipends of $100-$300 per artist. 
This is not much of a stipend but with 30 installations we need a minimum of $3,000 to pay the artists a minimum $100 stipend. And since a guy raised $55,000 for potato salad, surely we can raise $3000 to help pay the artists ;) 

Your donations will also go towards Lusio production which includes but is not limited to the following... 

Artist Stipends

35+ generators rentals

Van/Truck rentals

Permits, insurances, licenses

Marketing- promotional materials, website, ad's

Signage 

Free glowing gifts for children

Sound Equipment rentals

AV rentals

story:
Many of you may know me as a professional trumpet player, but for the past eleven years I have been focusing intensely on transitioning to piano as my primary instrument. Over the last eight years I have been studying with master piano teacher William Daghlian.  In working with Daghlian, we have discovered that with his focus on classical technique and rigorous training, and my background in jazz, the music of George Gershwin is a natural fit. 

For almost five years I have been preparing to record an album of solo piano works by George Gershwin.  I have performed this program in many recitals during the last 6 months.   With  my wife and I expecting our second child in February, now is the time to complete this project before I am consumed with sleepless nights and caring for a newborn   

The recording will take place on December 3rd, 4th and 5th at the American Academy of Arts and Letters in upper Manhattan.   We are renting  a nine-foot model D Steinway piano from the selection of concert grand pianos at the Steinway factory.  I am seeking to raise $9,000 to help support the costs of production

 

The costs  of production include:

- three-day rental of the performance hall

- the piano rental and delivery from the Steinway Factory in Queens to the hall

- the sound engineer to record the album

- hiring a piano tuner to remain onsite during the recording

- licensing fees to the Gershwin Family Estate

- editing and mastering of the album

- manufacturing and distribution of CDs and digital downloads. 

All of the funds collected with this campaign will be used only for the production of this album.

 

You can follow this project on Instagram @rogerlentmusic

I will post something new every day during this 30 day campaign.

story:
My Story

I'm an artist like many others: I spent six years of my life achieving my dream of going to art school and getting my MFA, then post graduation the real world crept in and a full time job took over my life, leaving me with less and less time to dedicate to my art. Over the last two years I've been able to renew my focus, and this year I'm cranking it up to the next level with a personal challenge to paint one 4”x4” painting every day starting on April 6th and continuing for the next year. 365 paintings in 365 days.


What I need more than anything else is supporters and cheerleaders to keep me on-track and motivated throughout the year. I started this challenge to keep developing as an artist, and I brought it to Indiegogo to bring as many people into my world as I can. I know myself well enough to understand that I can’t and won’t do this alone. I'll have a day sometime within this next year where I won’t be up to creating, and if left on my own I won’t do it. One day will lead to two, two days will become a week, and before I know it the challenge will not be met. Knowing that I have all of you behind me and following the project will be my daily reminder that I have to keep going and not give in to the temptation to lay it aside.


What We Get:

The money that I raise will be used to buy supplies for my project (wood, paint, brushes, etc) and send my daily paintings to their new homes.

Again, it's more important to me is to get as many people as possible to follow the project throughout the year at artidt.tumblr.com and force me to achieve my goal!

If you are interested in making a monetary donation, I highly recommend the $45 option as you'll get to own a piece of the project. The perk at this level is to be a proud owner of one of the 365 paintings I will be creating for the challenge. Your date will be randomly assigned and I will take requests for specific dates on a first come first served basis. I will endeavor to get your painting mailed to you within a week of it’s creation UNLESS I reach my stretch goal of raising $5,000.


Stretch Goal:

If my stretch goal is reached, I'll be holding off on mailing all the paintings until 2016. This is because my stretch goal is to use the $5,000 to rent a gallery space and host a show and reception to display all 365 days worth of work.

I'm also going to be donating 5% of ANY amount that is raised to the Multicultural Magnet School in New London, CT, to help keep their amazing art program going strong.

Note: At the $100 contribution you will recieve 1 painting per $100 contribution. A big thank you to one of my contributors who pointed out that my phrasing was a bit wonky on this one!

I'm an artist like many others: I spent six years of my life achieving my dream of going to art school and getting my MFA, then post graduation the real world crept in and a full time job took over my life, leaving me with less and less time to dedicate to my art. Over the last two years I've been able to renew my focus, and this year I'm cranking it up to the next level with a personal challenge to paint one 4”x4” painting every day starting on April 6th and continuing for the next year. 365 paintings in 365 days.



What I need more than anything else is supporters and cheerleaders to keep me on-track and motivated throughout the year. I started this challenge to keep developing as an artist, and I brought it to Indiegogo to bring as many people into my world as I can. I know myself well enough to understand that I can’t and won’t do this alone. I'll have a day sometime within this next year where I won’t be up to creating, and if left on my own I won’t do it. One day will lead to two, two days will become a week, and before I know it the challenge will not be met. Knowing that I have all of you behind me and following the project will be my daily reminder that I have to keep going and not give in to the temptation to lay it aside.



What We Get:
The money that I raise will be used to buy supplies for my project (wood, paint, brushes, etc) and send my daily paintings to their new homes.
Again, it's more important to me is to get as many people as possible to follow the project throughout the year at artidt.tumblr.com and force me to achieve my goal!
If you are interested in making a monetary donation, I highly recommend the $45 option as you'll get to own a piece of the project. The perk at this level is to be a proud owner of one of the 365 paintings I will be creating for the challenge. Your date will be randomly assigned and I will take requests for specific dates on a first come first served basis. I will endeavor to get your painting mailed to you within a week of it’s creation UNLESS I reach my stretch goal of raising $5,000.






Stretch Goal:
If my stretch goal is reached, I'll be holding off on mailing all the paintings until 2016. This is because my stretch goal is to use the $5,000 to rent a gallery space and host a show and reception to display all 365 days worth of work.
I'm also going to be donating 5% of ANY amount that is raised to the Multicultural Magnet School in New London, CT, to help keep their amazing art program going strong.
Note: At the $100 contribution you will recieve 1 painting per $100 contribution. A big thank you to one of my contributors who pointed out that my phrasing was a bit wonky on this one!

story:
Getting our Bristol artists out into the world (and hopefully bringing a few back with them).

My name is Jon and I’m hoping to help some of the city’s greatest artists raise funds to get their art out there and find a new audience somewhere on the globe. Appropriately, I’m starting with one of my oldest friends and favourite artists, Sepr. If you don’t know him, take a look at his work here .

 (To take a quick peek at the ltd print perks available, click here)

Sepr’s been invited to exhibit in Melbourne in April as part of a British Council initiative. This is a partnership with the Arts Council for freelance and self employed artist based in the UK to get out and reach global audiences, 'The Artist's International Development Fund'.  While we have a good chance of receiving this fund, he was only able to apply for 33% of funding and needed to raise the other 66% himself. We only have until the 6th of March to raise the match funding, so seeing as he’s such a popular lad, I thought I’d put in a little leg work and see if between you Melburnians and us Bristolians and a little help from the rest of the world we could get him to exhibit to what I believe will be a hugely receptive audience.


In contributing to this campaign, you will get something amazing in return – be it an original sketch and Thank You from Sepr, a limited edition print or the chance to commission your very own large-scale work.

(Brand New 'Putting the Band Back Together' Ltd Ed 3 Colour Print Perk -->)

Sepr’s approach to DIY art stretches back to his days as the drummer of Five Knuckle in the early 2000s. This method of staunchly independent artistry means he is one of Bristol’s most active and prolific artists, with distinct graphic style and every image layered with ideas and wit. Sadly, as with a lot of great artists and hard workers, this does not necessarily equate into the most lucrative of professions. 

(Melvins Handscreen Printed Print 2012, Signed by the Band and Artist ---->)


For the trip – with visas, the studio costs, the exhibition spaces, travel, materials, Easter flights, the fees for using this crowd funding resource and wall-to-wall painting and exhibiting in and around Melbourne – we need to raise £2400 to get him over for April. These cost do not include any accommodation or personal costs for the journeys and are all strictly professional costs for the trip. 

(Click Here for 'I Love You sometimes I just wish you didn't exist')

Every donation is incredibly appreciated and I believe there is something hugely exciting about people collectively supporting their artist friends. It’s also great to give the people of Melbourne the chance to become actively involved in bringing over an artist they want to paint their walls.

This is why we have created a couple of tiers of ‘Perks’. Instead of simply asking for a handout, we want to get Sepr working when he gets to Melbourne and hit the ground running, painting, meeting people, getting involved. 

(Very Last Ltd Ed Signed Print of this design Available in the Perks to the Left --->)

Original Large Scale Mural (Melbourne Only)- The top offer is to get one of three opportunities to get an original large scale Sepr mural on your wall. This could be your business such as a café, garage, pub or a private wall or fence in your back yard. This is a special perk for you Melburnians alone (Max. size approx. 3x10m).   

Sepr-gram (1 x Bristol, 1 x Melbourne)  Whether you need to send a unique Birthday message or maybe a proposal for marriage or simply want to tell someone ‘they’re alright’, why not send your very own Sepr-gram? With your assistance in finding a suitable wall, Sepr will paint a one-off mural (Max. 3x3m) expressing your message, then take a photo and make a card enabling you to give a very special one off present to someone. This is only available in Bristol or Melbourne. 

(Last available ltd Ed 'Kweenie' Print from 

Sepr Band Poster Design  (Worldwide) - Along with the wall painting and illustration, Sepr has designed posters for some of the world’s greatest bands. From Queens of the Stone Age, Mike Watt and the Melvins to Dan le Sac Vs Scroobius Pip. This is a one-time opportunity to get a bespoke design for your band or film. Take a look at his designs, get an idea, and then through online consultation (via email and Skype) you will get your very own Sepr design to use as you see fit. (Available to be completed either in Feb or April.)

There are also heaps of prints and bespoke sketches on offer. Every contribution helps to get our Sepr one step closer to taking up that invitation to exhibit and the walls of Melbourne. 

Thank you so much for reading and if you are unable to contribute financially then there are loads of other ways to help by spreading the word, sharing this link, liking his Fb page and inviting your friends to do the same, following us on twitter, or inviting Sepr to new places or simply by showing a bit of love and encouragement.

Thanks again and any questions or invitations or messages either send via here or directly to Sepr at 'SPSEPR at Gmail.com'


Thank You!

story:
Our Book - A Mecca Magnum Opus of the Creative World


What is Our Book, you may be asking yourself?

A Mecca-Magnum-Opus of the creative world to put on your shelf.

I spent two years reworking the art time and time again,

Then once the art was ready to share, I wrote a story to explain.

My hopes and dreams for this creation,

Now it’s ready to share with the world, I just need some donations.

Right now money donations will allow me to mail our book to different nations,

And help me travel and spread the book and find writers for new interpretations.


If you have a few minutes, please read below,

It explains all my ideas, and the ideals I have sown.

There are many ways to be involved,

And always more ways as the project evolves.

Please share with your friends, and let the world know,

That their is this crazy artist ready to break the status quo.


A Call to all Creators and Inventors, all you creative folk.


How can you take part of this grand adventure,

Good news, it’s now an uber joint-venture.

For painters I am bringing the original pages around,

For painters to paint over and their soul can be found.
For writers and poets, I have a challenge for you too,

Write your poem for the artwork, I want to see what your brain construes.

I’ll scribe the book in any language that is written,

Then all at once, a multi-pronged attack, we can change the system.



The Future of this Project


In year 3 of this project I hope to build a life sized version,

Every page 7x11 feet in dimension for complete submersion,

A 600 foot long maze for people to wander,

To escape from the world, to meditate and ponder.


In year 4 of this idea I hope to build an art hive on a piece of land,

For all the Anonymice Art Collective Members to come and collaborate and take a stand.

A community of little yurts filled with crazy contraptions,

A place for people to visit and focus on their passions.


Then in year five years time I will have the network and connections,

To start The Hearts for Arts foun

dation and give our book another direction.


To supply childrens hospitals with quality art supplies,

And coordinate local artists to do art with the kids and improvise.


Gunter and Felix Graphic Novel


I plan to document the whole journey through graphic novels,

On the Spirit of Scientifica, an airship that travels,

Through the cloud. Gunter will fly, with Felix by his side,

And all the other art collective members I meet worldwide.

I’ll write a Sunday Comic weekly, Calvin and Hobbes size,
With other little stories to be published as a surprise.

story:
About this project

For many years, I've counseled at-risk children, most of whom have been unable to put into words their suffering.  However, when given paint and a brush, they have created poignant narratives of fear, loneliness, feelings of abandonment, and longing for care and love.  From these children, I've learned the real power art holds. Through seeing their pain eloquently expressed in pictures, I've come to be an artist.

My name is David El Romo, and I'm a metal sculptor.  I use discarded metal - everyday items found in the back of your garage or at the junkyard - and I recycle, re-purpose them for sculptures that hopefully delight and provoke discussion. 

I'm publishing my first book, Art Repurposed: Malleable, Mutable Metal in Motion.   100% of the proceeds from the sale of my book will go toward funding workshops and purchasing supplies so that I may continue my outreach to at-risk children. 


How you can help

Your generous donations will help me reach my project budget of $25,000.  My book is more than just an art book.  I've chosen to keep the amount of actual writing in my book to a minimum so to really focus on the art itself and its emotive power.  My book is a story told through images of being lost and finding yourself over and over again.  It is a story with resonance for most who are continually searching for renewal and reconciliation with the events of their past.  

In making a book, my hope is that all of my deeply personal works when bound together form a tapestry that can be experienced and felt on visceral level.  These are my stories and they are the stories of the children with whom I've worked with all of these years. 

Your contribution goes toward backing the production of my book and its release.  By February 1st, 2014, the book will be sent to the printer for manufacturing.  8 weeks later on March 30th, books will be delivered to my door ready to ship to reward the Indiegogo pledges. 


Perks for your contribution

  • A signed postcard featuring one of my award-winning sculptures
  • Art Repurposed, my book
  • Your copy of Art Repurposed signed by me
  • A personally autographed copy of my book for you and/or a friend
  • Acknowledgement in my book as one of the people who made it happen
  • A unique piece of artwork

Tell everybody 

By donating to my campaign, you are making a difference in the life of an at risk child. Please tell everybody about my campaign.  Your family, your friends, your acquaintances, your co-workers and ask them to help me out by posting this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, and wherever else people virtually gather. Help make it happen!  I appreciate all of your support in bringing Art Repurposed to life. Thank you everyone who helps me reach my goal, and thank you Indiegogo for providing this opportunity.

story:
LE RESIDENZE ARTISTICHE DI ACCASARTI

ACCASARTI è uno spazio per residenze d'artista, fondato dalla cooperazione di singole persone e delle associazioni culturali TRW e S'Umbra con una lunga esperienza nella realizzazione di progetti di arte contemporanea. Abbiamo affittato una piccola casa al piano terra di un antico edificio nel centro storico di Cagliari.
Su una collina che domina la città, ACCASARTI sta in uno dei vicoli stretti e tortuosi, tra numerosi piccoli centri d'arte e culture. ACCASARTI è un piccolo affascinante open space con archi in pietra e soppalco in legno, accanto c'è la scuola-laboratorio di fotografia di S 'Umbra, a pochi metri si trovano i laboratori del fabbro e del falegname, ed a pochi passi ci sono gallerie, musei, studi di arte e artigianato. Inoltre, un quartiere intero si muove intorno gli artisti in residenza, pronto a sostenerli calorosamente. Per tutti questi motivi ACCASARTI vuole invitare artisti internazionali a realizzare qui i loro progetti.

ACCASARTI ART RESIDENCIES

ACCASARTI is a space for artist residencies, founded by the cooperation of single persons and the cultural associations TRW and S'UMBRA, with a long experience in contemporary art projects, who rents a small house on the ground floor of an old building in the historic district of Cagliari. On a hill overlooking the city, ACCASARTI stays in one of the narrow alleys and winding roads between many little centers of art and culture. ACCASARTI is a small charming open space with stone arches and wood loft, beside there is S'Umbra photo school-lab , a few meters next you find the blacksmith's and carpenter's labs, and few steps away there are galleries, museums, studios arts and crafts. Furthermore, an entire neighborhood moves around the artists in residence, ready to warmly support them. For all this reasons ACCASARTI wants to invite international artists to realize here their projects .

Associazioni / Associations
TRW
S'UMBRA

Facebook di ACCASARTI/ ACCASARTI on Facebook
Facebook.com/ACCASARTI

LA RESIDENZA DI MARY ZYGOURI

Dall'11 ottobre all'11 novembre ACCASARTI ospita la residenza dell'artista greca Mary Zygouri, curata e voluta da Sustainable Happiness nell'ambito delle residenze artistiche del festival Alig'Art-futuro anteriore , e in collaborazione con TRW. L'artista lavorerà sul territorio di Cagliari per realizzare una delle sue performance simboliche, potenti e coinvolgenti.
Il suo lavoro "fende lo sguardo dello spettatore per introdurlo in un vortice di verità che fa i conti con la storia e con le problematiche attuali per evidenziare i collassi di un regime di potenza – di una società disciplinare (Foucault) – emersa dalla fine della politica e dalla fine dell’etica culturale." 


Mary Zygouri è un grande artista performer. I suoi progetti hanno un forte impatto sulla comunità in cui vengono realizzati e grande visibilità nel mondo dell'arte contemporanea.

TRW ha bisogno di coprire i costi della residenza. Chiediamo il sostegno per pagare le spese di affitto, il cachet dell'artista e il personale coinvolto nel progetto: un falegname, un segretario, un graphic designer, un fotografo, un operatore video e un operatore audio. In più vorremmo poter rimborsare le spese quotidiane dell'artista. 

Aiutaci a sostenere le spese di produzione.

Diventa co-produttore di un grande progetto di arte.

Ad ACCASARTI accadranno delle cose meravigliose anche grazie al tuo contributo.


MARY ZYGOURI ART RESIDENCE

From 11 October to 11 November ACCASARTI hosts the residence project of the Greek artist Mary Zygouri, which will work in the territory of Cagliari to achieve one of its symbolic , powerful and engaging performances.
His work "cleaves the viewer's gaze to introduce it into a vortex of truth who comes to terms with the history and current issues to highlight the collapse of a regime of power - of a disciplinary society (Foucault) - emerged after the end of the political and the end of cultural ethics. "

Mary Zygouri is a great performer artist, which worked with international artists like Marina Abramovic and Michelangelo Pistoletto. Her projects have a strong impact in the community where are realized and great visibility in the world of contemporary art.

TRW  needs to covered the residence expenses. We ask for support to pay the rental costs , the cachet for the artist and for the staff involved in the project: a carpenter, a secretary, a graphic designer, a photographer, a video operator and an audio operator . We also want to cover the daily expenses of the artist.

Help us to bear the costs of production.

You have the opportunity to become a co-producer of a very great art project.

In ACCASARTI wonderful things can happens thanks to your contribution.

Mary Zygouri on web:
blogspot.it
vimeo.com
Facebook.com


PRODURRE UNA GRANDE OPERA D'ARTE

Mary è appena rientrata dal festival Aeschylian 2014 ad  Elefsina, l'antica Eleusi, dove ha realizzato una performance in collaborazione con Michelangelo Pistoletto per i riti Eleusini. Una azione concepita come una processione laica, nella quale il pubblico presente, come in  pellegrinaggio, l'ha accompagnata lungo il percorso.

Subito dopo la fine della performance l'artista si è rivolta al pubblico con queste parole: "Sento questa città dentro la mia pelle ... il tunnel in cui sono entrata, i serbatoi della TITAN*, il cemento dentro cui ho camminato... sento il mio corpo sofferente ma mi sento felice per i momenti che abbiamo vissuto attraversando questa città. E' come se fossi stata nel mio sogno, nella mia utopia; questa folla che ha riempito la città con le sue tracce, è stato un invito a camminare verso l’utopia... " * la TITAN è una industria del cemento di Elefsina, causa di inquinamento.

in un'intervista Mary dichiara :

"Un grande capitolo della storia greca moderna è stato scritto in questa zona, qui gli elementi del paesaggio sono tanti, lotte sindacali, incidenti, inquinamento…la possibilità di dialogo tra il mito e il paesaggio è per me una grande sfida...Il ruolo dell'artista è quello di suggerire una nuova prospettiva della realtà, con un suggestivo, poetico e forse profondamente politico modo di aprire nuove prospettive, creare nuove immagini"

Il territorio di Cagliari e della Sardegna è la prossima sfida della ricerca di Mary Zygouri, che affronterà tutte le contraddizioni e le difficoltà di questo territorio.

TRW seguirà l'artista lungo tutto il processo creativo e realizzerà un documentario sulla residenza artistica.
Il documentario vuole rivelare un aspetto inedito del lavoro di Zygouri, da cui far emergere le procedure e le metodologie del suo lavoro oltre che le sue motivazioni teoriche e concettuali. Produrremo un cofanetto contenente un set di cartoline della residenza e un DVD con il documentario e la realizzazione video della performance finale, realizzato dall'artista.


THE PRODUCTION OF A MASTER PIECE

Mary is just back from the Aeschylian festival 2014 in Elefsina, the ancient Eleusis, where she made a performance in collaboration with Michelangelo Pistoletto for the Eleusinian rites. The action conceived as a lay procession, in which the audience, as a pilgrimage, accompanied her across the city.

Immediately after the end of the performance, the artist turned to the audience with these words: "I feel this city inside my skin ... the tunnel in which I entered, the tanks of the TITAN *, the cement in which I walked .. . I feel my body sufferent, but I feel happy for the moments we have lived toghether passing through this town. I felt as if I was in my dream, in my utopia... this crowd that filled the city with his tracks, it was an invitation to walking towards utopia ... "

* the TITAN is a cement industry, cause of pollution of the territory in Elefsina

To explain the challenge of this performance Mary says in an interview:

"A large chapter of the Modern Greek history has been written in that zone. The elements in the landscape are so many, labor struggles, accidents, pollution etc. (...)The possibility of dialogue between myth and landscape is for me a great challenge. Besides the role of the artist is to able to suggest a new perspective of reality, with an suggestive, poetic, perhaps deep political way, to open new perspectives, new images "

The territory of Cagliari and Sardinia is the next challenge for the research of Mary Zygouri, which will address all the contradictions and difficulties of this territory in the resulting performance.

TRW will follow the artist throughout all the creative process and will make a documentary about the artist residency.
The documentary aims to reveal a inedited aspect of the work of Zygouri, which bring out the procedures and methods of her work as well as its theoretical and conceptual reasons. We will produce a special box containing a set of postcard of the residence and the DVD with the documentary and the video release of the performance, edited by the artist

Mary Zygouri interview -Efi Michalarou - dreamideamachine.com 

Mary Zygouri - SudLab - Aeschylian festival 2014


LA GRANDE SFIDA DEL PROGETTO ACCASARTI

ACCASARTI vuole essere un programma indipendente di Residenze Artistiche. Il crowdfunding può essere la grande occasione di costruire questo progetto con tutta la nostra passione e professionalità dalla pressione e vincoli delle grandi finanziamenti pubblici, con il sostegno delle persone, e la solidarietà di un pubblico attivo e partecipe.


Questo è il motivo per cui abbiamo bisogno del vostro sostegno non solo in termini di donazioni di denaro, ma anche con la vostra partecipazione attiva al progetto. Vi invitiamo a prendere parte alla residence, venendo nello spazio di ACCASARTI, e aiutando i collaboratori e l'artista come potete e quanto potete. Entra a far parte del progetto e contribuisci al successo della performance di Mary Zygouri.


THE BIG CHALLENGE OF THE ACCASARTI PROJECT

ACCASARTI aims to be an Indipendent program of Artistic Residencies. The crowdfunding can be the great chance to build up this project with all our passion and professionality out of the pressure and the constrains of the big public fundings, with the support of the true people, and the warm solidarity of an active and involved audience. 

This is why we need your support not just in terms of money donation, but also in your active partecipation to the project. We invite you to take part at the residece, join to ACCASARTI space, helping the staff and the artist as you can and how much you can. Become part of the project and contributes to the success of the Mary Zygouri's performance.


COME SUPPORTARCI

Dona del denaro per il progetto
Vieni ad ACCASARTI durante la residenza,
Promuovi il progetto nei tuoi social network
Condividi i nostri contenuti nel Web
Parla del progetto ACCASARTI con i tuoi amici e familiari


HOW YOU CAN HELP US

Donates money to the project
Join to ACCASARTI during the residence,
Promote the project in your social network
Share our contents in the Web
Talk about ACCASARTI project withyour friends and family
story_txt:
LE RESIDENZE ARTISTICHE DI ACCASARTI
 ACCASARTI è uno spazio per residenze d'artista, fondato dalla cooperazione di singole persone e delle associazioni culturali TRW e S'Umbra con una lunga esperienza nella realizzazione di progetti di arte contemporanea. Abbiamo affittato una 
piccola casa al piano terra di un antico edificio nel centro storico di 
Cagliari. Su una collina che domina la città, ACCASARTI sta in uno 
dei vicoli stretti e tortuosi, tra numerosi piccoli centri d'arte e 
culture. ACCASARTI è un piccolo affascinante open space con archi
 in pietra e soppalco in legno, accanto c'è la scuola-laboratorio di 
fotografia di S 'Umbra, a pochi metri si trovano i laboratori del fabbro e 
del falegname, ed a pochi passi ci sono gallerie, musei, studi di arte e
 artigianato. Inoltre, un quartiere intero si muove intorno gli artisti 
in residenza, pronto a sostenerli calorosamente. Per tutti questi motivi
 ACCASARTI vuole invitare artisti internazionali a realizzare qui i loro
 progetti.

ACCASARTI ART RESIDENCIES
ACCASARTI is a space for artist residencies, founded by the cooperation of single persons and the cultural associations TRW and S'UMBRA, with a long experience in contemporary art projects, who rents a small house on the ground floor of an old building in the historic district of Cagliari. On a hill overlooking the city, ACCASARTI stays in one of the narrow alleys and winding roads between many little centers of art and culture. ACCASARTI is a small charming open space with stone arches and wood loft, beside there is S'Umbra photo school-lab , a few meters next you find the blacksmith's and carpenter's labs, and few steps away there are galleries, museums, studios arts and crafts. Furthermore, an entire neighborhood moves around the artists in residence, ready to warmly support them. For all this reasons ACCASARTI wants to invite international artists to realize here their projects .Associazioni / AssociationsTRW S'UMBRAFacebook di ACCASARTI/ ACCASARTI on FacebookFacebook.com/ACCASARTI
  

 LA RESIDENZA DI MARY ZYGOURI

 
Dall'11 ottobre all'11 novembre ACCASARTI ospita la residenza 
dell'artista greca Mary Zygouri, curata e voluta da Sustainable Happiness nell'ambito delle residenze artistiche del festival Alig'Art-futuro anteriore , e in collaborazione con TRW.  L'artista lavorerà sul territorio di Cagliari
 per realizzare una delle sue performance simboliche, potenti e 
coinvolgenti. Il suo lavoro "fende lo sguardo dello spettatore 
per introdurlo in un vortice di verità che fa i conti con la storia e 
con le problematiche attuali per evidenziare i collassi di un regime di 
potenza – di una società disciplinare (Foucault) – emersa dalla fine 
della politica e dalla fine dell’etica culturale." 
Mary Zygouri è 
un grande artista performer. I suoi progetti hanno 
un forte impatto sulla comunità in cui vengono realizzati e grande 
visibilità nel mondo dell'arte contemporanea. TRW ha bisogno di coprire i costi della residenza. Chiediamo il sostegno per pagare le spese di affitto, il 
cachet dell'artista e il personale coinvolto nel 
progetto: un falegname, un segretario, un graphic designer, un 
fotografo, un operatore video e un operatore audio. In più vorremmo poter rimborsare le spese 
quotidiane dell'artista. 
Aiutaci a sostenere le spese di produzione.
Diventa co-produttore di un grande progetto di arte.
Ad ACCASARTI accadranno delle cose meravigliose anche grazie al tuo contributo. 



 

MARY ZYGOURI ART RESIDENCE

From 11 October to 11 November ACCASARTI hosts the residence project of the Greek artist Mary Zygouri, which will work in the territory of Cagliari to achieve one of its symbolic , powerful and engaging performances. His work "cleaves the viewer's gaze to introduce it into a vortex of truth who comes to terms with the history and current issues to highlight the collapse of a regime of power - of a disciplinary society (Foucault) - emerged after the end of the political and the end of cultural ethics. "
Mary Zygouri is a great performer artist, which worked with international artists like Marina Abramovic and Michelangelo Pistoletto. Her projects have a strong impact in the community where are realized and great visibility in the world of contemporary art. 
TRW  needs to covered the residence expenses. We ask for support to pay the rental costs , the cachet for the artist and for the staff involved in the project: a carpenter, a secretary, a graphic designer, a photographer, a video operator and an audio operator . We also want to cover the daily expenses of the artist. Help us to bear the costs of production.You have the opportunity to become a co-producer of a very great art project.In ACCASARTI wonderful things can happens thanks to your contribution.Mary Zygouri on web:blogspot.itvimeo.comFacebook.comPRODURRE UNA GRANDE OPERA D'ARTE

Mary è appena rientrata dal festival Aeschylian 2014 ad  Elefsina, l'antica Eleusi, dove ha realizzato una performance in collaborazione con Michelangelo Pistoletto per i riti Eleusini. Una azione concepita come una processione laica, nella quale il pubblico presente, come in  pellegrinaggio, l'ha accompagnata lungo il percorso. Subito dopo la fine della performance l'artista si è rivolta al pubblico con queste parole: "Sento questa città dentro la mia pelle ... il tunnel in cui sono entrata, i serbatoi della TITAN*, il cemento dentro cui ho camminato... sento il mio corpo sofferente ma mi sento felice per i momenti che abbiamo vissuto attraversando questa città. E' come se fossi stata nel mio sogno, nella mia utopia; questa folla che ha riempito la città con le sue tracce, è stato un invito a camminare verso l’utopia... " * la TITAN è una industria del cemento di Elefsina, causa di inquinamento.
in un'intervista Mary dichiara :
"Un grande capitolo della storia greca moderna è stato scritto in questa zona, qui gli elementi del paesaggio sono tanti, lotte sindacali, incidenti, inquinamento…la possibilità di dialogo tra il mito e il paesaggio è per me una grande sfida...Il ruolo dell'artista è quello di suggerire una nuova prospettiva della realtà, con un suggestivo, poetico e forse profondamente politico modo di aprire nuove prospettive, creare nuove immagini"
Il territorio di Cagliari e della Sardegna è la prossima sfida della ricerca di Mary Zygouri, che affronterà tutte le contraddizioni e le difficoltà di questo territorio.
TRW seguirà l'artista lungo tutto il processo creativo e realizzerà un documentario sulla residenza artistica.Il documentario vuole rivelare un aspetto inedito del lavoro di Zygouri, da cui far emergere le procedure e le metodologie del suo lavoro oltre che le sue motivazioni teoriche e concettuali. Produrremo un cofanetto contenente un set di cartoline della residenza e un DVD con il documentario e la realizzazione video della performance finale, realizzato dall'artista.


THE PRODUCTION OF A MASTER PIECE
Mary is just back from the Aeschylian festival 2014 in Elefsina, the ancient Eleusis, where she made a performance in collaboration with Michelangelo Pistoletto for the Eleusinian rites. The action conceived as a lay procession, in which the audience, as a pilgrimage, accompanied her across the city. Immediately after the end of the performance, the artist turned to the audience with these words: "I feel this city inside my skin ... the tunnel in which I entered, the tanks of the TITAN *, the cement in which I walked .. . I feel my body sufferent, but I feel happy for the moments we have lived toghether passing through this town. I felt as if I was in my dream, in my utopia... this crowd that filled the city with his tracks, it was an invitation to walking towards utopia ... " 
* the TITAN is a cement industry, cause of pollution of the territory in Elefsina

To explain the challenge of this performance Mary says in an interview:
"A large chapter of the Modern Greek history has been written in that zone. The elements in the landscape are so many, labor struggles, accidents, pollution etc. (...)The possibility of dialogue between myth and landscape is for me a great challenge. Besides
 the role of the artist is to able to suggest a new perspective of 
reality, with an suggestive, poetic, perhaps deep political way, to open new perspectives, new images "



 


The territory of Cagliari and Sardinia is the next challenge for the research of Mary Zygouri, which will address all the contradictions and difficulties of this territory in the resulting performance.TRW will follow the artist throughout all the creative process and will make a documentary about the artist residency. The documentary aims to reveal a inedited aspect of the work of Zygouri, which bring out the procedures and methods of her work as well as its theoretical and conceptual reasons. We will produce a special box containing a set of postcard of the residence and the DVD with the documentary and the video release of the performance, edited by the artist
Mary Zygouri interview -Efi Michalarou - dreamideamachine.com  
Mary Zygouri - SudLab - Aeschylian festival 2014

  ACCASARTI vuole essere un programma indipendente di Residenze Artistiche. Il crowdfunding può essere la grande occasione di costruire questo progetto con tutta la nostra passione e professionalità dalla pressione e vincoli delle grandi finanziamenti pubblici, con il sostegno delle persone, e la solidarietà di un pubblico attivo e partecipe. Vi invitiamo a prendere parte alla residence, venendo nello spazio di ACCASARTI, e aiutando i collaboratori e l'artista come potete e quanto potete. Entra a far parte del progetto e contribuisci al successo della performance di Mary Zygouri.



THE BIG CHALLENGE OF THE ACCASARTI PROJECT
ACCASARTI aims to be an Indipendent program of Artistic Residencies. The crowdfunding can be the great chance to build up this project with all our passion and professionality out of the pressure and the constrains of the big public fundings, with the support of the true people, and the warm solidarity of an active and involved audience. 

This is why we need your support not just in terms of money donation, but also in your active partecipation to the project. We invite you to take part at the residece, join to ACCASARTI space, helping the staff and the artist as you can and how much you can. Become part of the project and contributes to the success of the Mary Zygouri's performance.

COME SUPPORTARCI

story:
Let's do this

I love discovering new art galleries. Art itself is very much about discovery. But there's no single point for doing this in Belgium. Information is fragmented along regional lines or simply covers one type of art. I don't approach art in these kind of silos. I'm just as happy looking at something painted yesterday as I am looking at works by Old Masters.

This is why I'm building KunstArt.be. I want people to be able to discover art anywhere and everywhere in Belgium. Whether you live in Belgium or are a visitor to the country this could be the best resource for easily finding out where to discover art near you.

This Is Where We Are After Week 1


What We Need & What You Get

I've started to build the new website in a very public and open way. If you visited it on day one, you saw something functional, but very basic and with no design.

I'll release a new version every 5 days ( at least ) adding layers and new functions as we go along. Think of it a bit like painting a picture in public. Right now there's a blank canvas with a few sketch lines.

If the funding goes beyond the initial goal I may consider putting time into a dedicated mobile app as well.

In return for supporting KunstArt during the development phase, you'll receive fame and fortune through recognition on out Wall of Fame patrons' page. And of course my undying appreciation.

Any little helps, even just as recognition that you understand and believe in the project. Thank you!

The Impact

There are great publications out there that list events and galleries in Belgium. But none of them are comprehensive, giving 100% coverage of all locations and all types of art. Some are limited by their funders as to the regions they can cover, others curate events of a specific type.

I believe there's a place for a comprehensive directory that lets the modern, busy, flâneur discover new places, and art just around the corner.

The Road Map

These are the very broad milestones that we are working to, but we will adapt based on your feedback.

  1. Make galleries searchable across multiple languages, EN, NL, FR, DE ( 50% done, but not live yet )
  2. Update the gallery list ( updated to 453 galleries at last count, always on ongoing )
  3. Add the city maps so that you can discover galleries just by looking at a map
  4. Add optional geolocation so that you can find galleries near you.
  5. Enhance the gallery profile page ( 20% done. Gallery location map now added )
  6. Start collecting artist data
  7. Start collecting event data
  8. Give credit to the people that supported the development of the website on our patrons' page ( Ongoing of course )
  9. Enable registered members to create and curate lists of galleries. These lists can be private or shared with the rest of the community
  10. Set up blogs under the kunstart.be umbrella for people that want to write about art in Belgium and Belgian artists abroad.
  11. Build a process to schedule tweets for vernissages and finissages so that you'll never miss another opening.
  12. YOU DECIDE!
Just giving a couple of Euros can give a real boost to the campaign.

Risks & Challenges

I made an initial version of the website in 2008 so a lot of the gallery data was already collected then. But it was not possible to maintain the site as a hobby. But technology has moved on a lot since then, mobile use has increased dramatically and the idea of pulling your mobile phone out of your pocket to discover something to do in the vicinity is now very common.

The new website is responsive and will include optional geolocation so that KunstArt can suggest galleries near you. So it will be  handy tool when you are out and about in town.

I have started to collect new gallery data and clean up the old list. The new version of the site will enable registered members to suggest places, events and artists and to make their own lists of favourites. It will have many more community elements than the original.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the idea, please contribute to the campaign. If you can help in some other way too that's much appreciated.

  • Tell all your friends.
  • Send a tweet about the campaign.
  • Talk about KunstArt.be on Facebook.
  • Check the data to make sure the galleries you know about are listed.
  • Write a blog post about discovery and our campaign.
  • If you visit a new gallery, mention that you found them on KunstArt.be

All help and support greatly appreciated and acknowledged. 

We are also looking for bloggers to join the project either as guest writers or to host their own blog under the KunstArt umbrella. Which language? You decide. We're open and happy to hear your ideas.

story:
Welcome, friends! 

And thank you for joining Art Mobile as we begin our mission to inspire creativity in The City Beautiful: Orlando Florida, and feature artists in a new and unique way. 

Imagine going for a walk at your favorite park, or heading to your usual haunt, only to come across live music, appetizing aromas, and an eclectic display of art.

That's us!

From a distance, we may seem like a simple moving truck, but as you approach, you'll discover so much more. 

Inside you’ll find thought-provoking artwork created by talented artists from your own community. You’ll have the opportunity to peruse our carefully curated shows and get to know the great artists behind the work. The next day we’ll be gone – on to deliver a memorable experience in the next area of town.

For each show, we plan to have an opening night, premiering work from great new artists in the Orlando community. We’ll be working with food trucks, musicians, DJs and performers to create a one-of-a-kind evening to remember that’s free and open to the public. After our opening, the show will continue on to many other locations throughout the month, to areas like Altamonte Springs, Maitland, Winter Garden and Sanford.

We would also like to make an impact with art students throughout the city, and plan to display our truck at local high schools. We want to show students that a career in the arts is rewarding, lucrative and vital to helping Orlando become an even more dynamic and cultured city. In conjunction with our sponsor at The Art XChange, we also plan to host art supply drives for elementary and middle school art programs.

Among the Art Mobile ranks you’ll find an art buyer, event coordinator, legal assistant, gallery curator, and photographer. We came together around this wonderful concept and have already poured countless hours into bringing Art Mobile to life. We can’t wait to see it become a reality!

As you can see, we have big plans for Art Mobile and Orlando, but first we need to raise funds to get Art Mobile up and running. Art Mobile events will always be free and open to the public, so please consider making a donation right now, so that we can bring this project to fruition. 

We need capital to pay for:

-The truck
-Gas
-Materials
-Permits
-Misc. legal fees

Your support will help our big idea become an amazing reality.


But your donation won’t just assist us. It will benefit you as well. Check out the awesome perks provided by our first two featured artists, so that you can bring more art into your life right now. Thanks to Jason Littlefield and Chris Tobar Rodriguez, we have numbered prints, limited edition t-shirts and other goodies, our way of saying thank you for helping us reach our goals. Any donation, from $1 to $1,000 can make a difference in this campaign. Please, donate any amount that you think would help Art Mobile to be a reality.


PERK #1: LIMITED EDTION PIN & STICKER



PERK #2: LIMITED EDTION T-SHIRT (BY CHRIS TOBAR)



PERK #3: LIMITED EDTION PRINT (BY JASON LITTLEFIELD)


PERK #4: LIMITED EDTION "GOODIE BAG"


PERK #5: TWO EVENT TICKETS!


PERK #6: TWO VIP PASSES!


PERK #7: ART MOBILE SPONSORSHIP!


THANK YOU FOR STOPPING IN!

Please consider making a donation of at least $15 today, but every little bit helps. In addition, please share our story with your friends via Facebook, Twitter, e-mail and over dinner!

And we want to hear from you too! If you are interested in collaborating or volunteering, please don’t hesitate to get in touch. Any ideas you may have to make for a more successful launch would be greatly appreciated.

story:
Growing up, I was always enthralled by horror movies, and I remember staying up late to catch I Know What You Did Last Summer on TV, or using the entire bus ride home to plan to appeal to my mom that since I stayed up late to watch Scream last night, I need to stay up to watch the rest of the trilogy tonight and tomorrow. It was exciting and thrilling and had a very enjoyable lively feeling to it, and to this day, I credit a lot of that to the genre's talented females. Those shrill screams, the damsel in distress, the psychotic (yet adorable!) killer - there was always something magical to me about the Laurie Strodes and Baby Fireflys of the genre. 

 Monstermoiselle is an independent publication featuring the girls of the horror and alternative genre and industry, from a small team of both females and males. We strive to avoid objectification, while still finding a line that doesn't cross pushing beliefs of aggressive feminism or misandry. It's not about discounting men nor putting women on a pedestal - it's about thanking women for having blue hair instead of blonde, for getting dirty on late night sets in the middle of the woods with a thousand dollar budget, for giving a new face to fictional character types most often portrayed by men, and for showing us all that applying male pronouns when talking about photographers, filmmakers, authors and designers should not always be the default. Above all, Monstermoiselle has become a love letter to independent creatives and projects full of passion.

Our first issue is currently at about 70% completion, and includes some fantastical things for all lovers of horror, art, hot babes, strong female accomplishments and indie projects as a whole.  

All features noted below are 100% completed, cleared and guaranteed to be in the issue!

  • "Welcome to The Niky Show!" - An interview with Italian Alternative model Niky Hearts. 
  • "No Stephen Kings Were Harmed in The Making of This Film" - An interview with You Can't Kill Stephen King star Kayle Blogna.
  • "Pretty Scary" - A handpicked collection of horror inspired fashion accessories, along with where to buy them. 
  • "Crafts for Creeps" - Exclusive creepy craft patterns and access to high quality, hand dyed yarn in gruesome color palettes made for Monstermoiselle by Bewitching Knits. 
  • "#TellMM" - We asked on twitter, you answered - and got your icon, handle and response printed in the magazine!
  • "Visiting Hours" - A look back at horror gems of years gone by with Rory Parker. 
  • Pinups galore! Yes, we went there. We've been contacting actresses, models, musicians and their photographers who've been kind enough to share some hi-res images with us, because you're never, ever too old or too cool to to appreciate magazine pages that become wall art. 
  • Reader freebies! Some of our collaborators have been kind enough to donate rad swag which we'll be able to give away via contests on our Twitter, and directly through each issue. 

And so much more! Each issue will have recurring columns by familiar artists and authors, as well as brand new content, interviews and articles. 

Every dollar goes a long way to ensuring we have enough funding to go to press. Each issue costs to be printed, after all. Additionally, we need money in order to buy the rights to print certain images, pay for shipping of our printed magazines to us, and again for shipping of the magazines to you! Your pledge money is the best way for our magazine to become a reality, and we want to see that happen!
story_txt:
Growing up, I was always enthralled by horror movies, and I remember staying up late to catch I Know What You Did Last Summer on TV, or using the entire bus ride home to plan to appeal to my mom that since I stayed up late to watch Scream last night, I need to stay up to watch the rest of the trilogy tonight and tomorrow. It was exciting and thrilling and had a very enjoyable lively feeling to it, and to this day, I credit a lot of that to the genre's talented females. Those shrill screams, the damsel in distress, the psychotic (yet adorable!) killer - there was always something magical to me about the Laurie Strodes and Baby Fireflys of the genre.  Monstermoiselle is an independent publication featuring the girls of the horror and alternative genre and industry, from a small team of both females and males. We strive to avoid objectification, while still finding a line that doesn't cross pushing beliefs of aggressive feminism or misandry. It's not about discounting men nor putting women on a pedestal - it's about thanking women for having blue hair instead of blonde, for getting dirty on late night sets in the middle of the woods with a thousand dollar budget, for giving a new face to fictional character types most often portrayed by men, and for showing us all that applying male pronouns when talking about photographers, filmmakers, authors and designers should not always be the default. "#TellMM" - We asked on twitter, you answered - and got your icon, handle and response printed in the magazine!

story:
UPOZORNENIE - platiť môžete, aj ak nemáte zažený PayPal účet. 

Stránka vás síce presmeruje do systému PayPalu, ako po anglicky upozorňuje, tam si však môžete vybrať aj možnosť platiť kreditnou alebo debetnou kartou. V PRÍPADE AKÝCHKOĽVEK KOMPLIKÁCIÍ, VRÁTANE JAZYKOVÝCH, NEVÁHAJTE SA NA NÁS OBRÁTIŤ A NAPÍSAŤ NA peter@slovakfilm.sk! 

Čo sú Detské 4 živly?

Pred štyrmi rokmi Letný filmový seminár 4 živly (www.4zivly.sk) do svojho programu prvý raz zaradil samostatnú sekciu venovanú deťom a ich rodičom. Zo skromného detského kútika s hračkami a premietaním filmov v banskoštiavnickej čajovni sa v priebehu rokov stala neoddeliteľná súčasť filmového seminára, jedného z najstarších a najobľúbenejších slovenských filmových podujatí. Program sa rozšíril, pribudol najskôr jeden workshop – animačný – a vlani sa spolu s ním úspechu u detí tešil aj hudobný workshop. S rozširujúcim sa programom ale rastie náročnosť organizácie a nevyhnutne aj produkčné náklady. Rozhodli sme sa preto obrátiť na Vás! Pomôžte nám zabezpečiť pre deti hodnotný program s výsledkami, ktoré môžu potešiť aj nás ostatných a ktoré môžu stáť na začiatku kariéry mladých slovenských filmárskych talentov!

16. Letný filmový seminár 4 živly s témou MOC sa bude konať v Banskej Štiavnici v dňoch 6. - 10. augusta 2014 a naším cieľom je aj tento rok vytvoriť v jeho programe priestor pre rodiny, v rámci ktorého sa deti (8 – 12 rokov) budú zoznamovať hravou, aktívnou a tvorivou formou s filmom a audiovizuálnym umením. Chceli by sme prispieť k formovaniu poučeného a vnímavého filmového diváka, potenciálneho tvorcu, ktorý sa orientuje vo svete médií a nie je len nekritickým konzumentom priemernej televíznej zábavy. Detské 4 živly sa budú konať od piatka 8. augusta do nedele 10. augusta 2014 a svojim účastníkom a účastníčkam ponúknu hudobný a animačný a workshop (oba kapacitne obmedzené, s účasťou viazanou na účastnícky poplatok a prihlásenie začiatkom júla), otvorené výtvarné dielne, ale aj premietania kvalitných filmov pre detské publikum.

Hudobný workshop

Na hudobnom workshope skupina detí (8 – 12 rokov) vymyslí a nacvičí skladbu ku krátkemu filmu. Nie je nevyhnutné, aby deti vedeli hrať na nejaký hudobný nástroj, súčasťou „ozvučenia“ filmu môžu byť aj rôzne ruchy, zvuky atď. Dôležité je, aby deti mali záujem o film a hudbu, aby boli motivované tvoriť a hrať sa. Tvoriť budú pod vedením profesionálnych a skúsených lektorov Antona Gútha a Pauly Pelić. Výslednú skladbu budú deti prezentovať naživo spolu s premietaním krátkeho filmu, ku ktorému skladba vznikla – samozrejme tiež za prítomnosti publika. Takže pôjde o akýsi koncert – premietanie so živou hudbou, ktorého záznam bude neskôr spracovaný a prezentovaný online. Tri miesta na hudobnom workshope sme v rámci osvedčenej spolupráce vyhradili banskoštiavnickým deťom zo sociálne slabších rodín. Viac informácií o lektoroch hudobného workshopu a ich aktivitách nájdete na www.rytmika.sk.  Možnosť prihlasovať sa na workshop otvoríme v prvý júlový týždeň, po skončení kampane, keď bude jasné, aké sú naše finančné možnosti. 

Animačný workshop

Lektorkami tohtoročného animačného workshopu, určeného pre deti od 8 do 12 rokov, budú vizuálne umelkyne a absolventky VŠVU Andrea Lenártová a Barbara Fehérová, dohromady známe ako Tri švestky. Spolu so skupinou detí vytvoria príbeh, ktorý rozdelia na jednotlivé epizódy – tie budú vytvárať a animovať deti v dvojiciach. Súčasťou práce bude vytvorenie postavičiek, prostredí, dekorácií a samostatná animácia pod vedením lektoriek a lektora (ktorý bude pomáhať so stop-motion animáciou). Pri výslednej animácii sa bude používať tzv. „tagtool“, čo je vizuálny inštrument, ktorý sa používa na javisku alebo vo verejných priestranstvách ulíc a budov. Animovaný film bude mať verejnú premiéru za účasti detí, rodičov a verejnosti a každé z detí dostane na pamiatku DVD s vytvoreným filmom. Film zavesíme na youtube, vimeo, facebook profil 4 živlov. Viac informácií o lektorkách workshopu nájdete na trisvestky.weebly.com/my.html. Aj v prípade animačného workshopu platí, že prihlášky bude možné podávať začiatkom júla a kapacity budú limitované. 

Výtvarné dielne

V priestoroch tvorivých dielní Terra Permonia pripravia výtvarníci Pavol Ďurák a Lucia Ďuráková Hronská výtvarné animačné dielne, na ktorých sa deti oboznámia s úplnými základmi filmovej animácie a samé si ju odskúšajú na sebou vytvorenej postavičke z papiera. Na rozdiel od workshopov pre vopred nahlásených účastníkov a účastníčky, výtvarné dielne sú voľne prístupné všetkým záujemcom a záujemkyniam. 

Premietania filmov

Výber filmov je ovplyvnený témou Letného filmového seminára 4 živly – MOC – a zároveň snahou organizátorov sprístupniť deťom aj staršie klasické filmy, ktoré ovplyvnili generáciu ich rodičov. Plánovaná je napríklad projekcia filmu o Pipi Dlhej Pančuche a jej špeciálnych schopnostiach, alebo Vynález skazy, dielo režiséra Karla Zemana, na motívy Julesa Vernea. Filmy budeme premietať nielen tradične v leháre čajovne Klopačka, ale aj v premietacej sále tvorivého centra Terra Permonia, kde sa môžete tešiť aj na projekciu zo 16mm filmového pásu.

Čo potrebujeme

1500 € je suma, ktorú potrebujeme na pokrytie nevyhnutných nákladov súvisiacich s technickým a personálnym zabezpečením oboch workshopov, výtvarných dielní a na zabezpečenie premietacích práv na filmy z programu Detských 4 živlov, ktoré tvoria podstatnú časť rozpočtu podujatia.

Čo môžete získať

V stĺpci napravo nájdete zoznam odmien, ktoré prináležia k jednotlivým výškam príspevkov. Kliknutím na vybranú odmenu sa nielen dostanete do systému, v ktorom môžete prispieť na organizáciu Detských 4 živlov, ale zabezpečíte si aj niektorú z pozorností alebo výhod prináležiacich k nej. V prípade úspechu kampane Vám Vašu odmenu doručíme krátko po jej skončení, prípadne odovzdáme priamo na Letnom filmovom seminári 4 živly v auguste, ak s ním odmena priamo súvisí (napríklad účasť na workshope alebo akreditácia na seminár). 

Risk

1500 €, ktoré by sme chceli vyzbierať, predstavuje reálnu sumu pokrývajúcu náklady spojené s organizáciou oboch workshopov, výtvarných dielní a záverečnej prezentácie, ale aj náklady potrebné na zisk filmových práv a kópií. V prípade, že sumu nevyzbierame, budeme musieť plánovaný program výrazne okresať. Ak však sumu získame, urobíme všetko, čo bude v našich silách, aby sme pre deti v Banskej Štiavnici pripravili nezabudnuteľný predĺžený víkend!

story:
Frisky

I'm Ronnie Werner and I draw beautiful women. I'm an artist focused on the female form and I'm producing a limited edition hardcover book of my new works titled Frisky.

I think the word Frisky describes my work quite well. 

I have been a Pin Up artist for 15 years and have been published in Heavy Metal and Penthouse Magazines. My work has shown in the Echo Gallery and Gallery Provocateur in Chicago, as well as The Seattle Erotic Art Festival, and a solo show at Ron Jeremy's Club Sesso. My book The Art of Ronnie Werner  was published in 2009.

Since the release of my first book, I have been creating art for the next one. I currently have over forty new sexy and fun pieces completed and they are begging to be seen. At least thirty more are in the works for the book.

In five years, publishing has changed dramatically. One positive outcome of this change is the accessibility of self publishing and the rise of crowd funding. With your help, I can publish Frisky and be in complete editorial and creative control of its content. 

So, I need your help.

$9,500.00 will cover printing and shipping of 1000 copies of Frisky, my full-color, 60-page hardcover book, and production fees, as well as shipping supporters' pre-orders. Frisky will be a limited-edition, signed and numbered book with exclusive content and a preview of my graphic novel. There are some fun perks/gifts for your contribution and I will add more as the campaign progresses.

If the campaign doesn't reach the $9,500 goal, I will not be able to produce the book as described. I will, however, print the best book I can in a smaller size and within the  budget available. If I exceed my funding goal I will add pages to the book as budget allows.

Thank you for your contribution and please spread the word about my book to friends, on social media, at a party, sitting at or swinging on the pole, to your barber, hairdresser or waxer, or to your mom if she's cool.

So, I need your help.
 $9,500.00 will cover printing and shipping of 1000 copies of Frisky, my full-color, 60-page hardcover book, and production fees, as well as shipping supporters' pre-orders. Frisky will be a limited-edition, signed and numbered book with exclusive content and a preview of my graphic novel. There are some fun perks/gifts for your contribution and I will add more as the campaign progresses.
If the campaign doesn't reach the $9,500 goal, I will not be able to produce the book as described. I will, however, print the best book I can in a smaller size and within the  budget available. If I exceed my funding goal I will add pages to the book as budget allows.
Thank you for your contribution and please spread the word about my book to friends, on social media, at a party, sitting at or swinging on the pole, to your barber, hairdresser or waxer, or to your mom if she's cool.

story:
Ann and the Skopelos Foundation

The Skopelos Foundation has invited me to be an artist-in-residence on Skopelos Island in Greece in June, 2014. What a thrilling opportunity for me to be inspired by another culture! As a printmaker and mixed media artist I will have access to their studio. I see this as a fortuitous invitation to expand my passion for learning, in particular, the role of tea in Greek culture. When I began the teabag project two years ago, I envisioned expanding it beyond American culture but could only dream that an opportunity like this would be presented. I invite you to assist me on this artistic adventure.

In the meantime I'm learning that in Greece, a holistic approach to health includes the drinking of tea. St. John's Wort, Linden Flowers and chamomile are often used. Lemon Verbena (Luiza) comes from the mountains of Greece and is good for digestion. I'll be sure to have some to help overcome the effects of jet lag.

The Costs

Although I'm honored to have been selected for this residency, the costs fall on my shoulders. Airfare alone is $1700. Housing is about $900. Transportation, food, tips, and some studio costs add up quickly.

I appreciate any financial support for this project but I understand if you can't contribute. If you cannot contribute, please send good wishes and your blessings.

story:
My name is Wes Modes and I'm an artist working toward my Masters in Fine Arts in the University of California Santa Cruz Digital Art and New Media program. 

I'm working on an interesting sculpture that I'd love to have your help with. This project will have important implications for a generation deeply-engaged in social networking.

FOMOphobia

FOMOphobia is a network-connected sculpture that monitors the state of the artist’s social networks, keeps count, and sounds alarms when there is unread content, possibly provoking one to reconsider the value of one’s relentless connectedness.

Fear Of Missing Out (FOMO) is a form of social anxiety described as “a compulsive concern that one might miss an opportunity for social interaction, a novel experience, or other satisfying event.” FOMO is the result of our bombardment by modern networking, more insidious because we take an active part in it, simultaneously stressed out about and perpetuating our own addiction.  

FOMOphobia brings this private guilt to the surface with glaring numeric displays and alarm bells. It exposes the artist’s social networking burden and addiction, revealing both the accumulation and content of his social media messages. FOMOphobia challenges viewers to re-weigh the cost of their participation in social media.

Helping Create Art

The installation has a few modest costs that are beyond the artist's even more modest budget. Your financial contribution will help make this sculpture happen.

Your contribution will directly pay for the materials used to create FOMOphobia, including displays, microcontrollers, and casing.  

FOMOphobia will make it's debut at the University of California Santa Cruz Digital Art and New Media Open Studios Exhibition on Friday December 6th. With or without a contribution, you are invited to come see the work beign exhibited, including FOMOphobia.

The Impact - Questioning Technology

FOMOphobia is technically challenging and conceptually interesting. Rarely does new media art question the technology it relies upon. FOMOphobia uses the artist's social networking to both vulnerably expose his social media content and question the value of our digital connectedness.

This work is expected to exhibit elsewhere beyond it's debut. Currently, FOMOphobia is being entered in exhibition calls throughout the country. So your support will enable the sculpture to live on and lead an exciting exhibition life beyond Open Studios.  

The artist has a successful track record of creating interactive sculpture and managing projects.  Please feel free to browse his art portfolio at http://modes.io/art/

Other Ways You Can Help

I'd love to have your financial contribution if you can afford it.  If not, I'd be honored if you'd spread the word about this campaign.  Use Indiegogo's sharing tools to get the word out, or share this campaign on facebook if you think it is worth people supporting.  

Thanks,

Wes Modes

For a full description, timetable, and budget, visit the FOMOphobia project site at http://modes.io/fomophobia-an-insistent-social-networking-anxiety-monitor/
