I am a young artist who graduated from the ArBA-esa [Brussels Royal Academy of Fine Arts – Graduate School of Arts], and currently an assistant lecturer in the (AesP) [Art in Public Space] studio of that establishment.  This position entails providing advice and support for the artistic approaches of students in creative and software-learning workshops on the question of real and virtual motion picture (video recording and 3D modelling respectively).
aerophagics contemporary is a fictional art gallery.  It questions (on the Web) the visibility and communication of institutions, galleries and actors in the field of art.  In the manner of a semionaut, it conducts a critique of social networks and the art market.  The latter is based on exclusion, because it concentrates exclusively on certain names which become products, the artistic value of which develops for the benefit of the market.  I was determined to create my own “stable” by giving it a name and logo.  To attain this positioning, I created a Facebook page and a stick with the same name affixed on the window of the premises during a stint as artist in residence in Ixelles.  aerophagics contemporary was included in the web page of Ixelles, as the opportunity arose, and is listed as a gallery established on the territory of that municipality.  aerophagics was thus made official and institutionalised, or at least it is henceforth visible “on the art scene.” What started as an appearance or illusion of an art gallery, at least from the outside, has now become reality.
In partnership with the AesP studio of the ArBA-Esa, I shared this project (in 2009-2010) with the students of that studio.  They created avatars on social networks such as Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter, by providing archetypes on how a gallery should be run “properly” by means of poses struck by aerophagics contemporary employees, artists, and collectors.  This fictitious entrepreneurial assemblage promoted mock discussions (exchanged e-mails) between collecting avatars and non-fictitious artists.  In order not to linger on a misleading false parody of supply and demand, genuine fictional works by artists gradually emerged through artistic productions and constructed identities (biographies, profiles and historical contexts, questions about art, philosophical discussions, etc) to lead to a real, autonomous identity, which continues to develop in cyberspace today by modelling exchange and information and by the note of the principles of interaction.  Some of these fictional creations were consigned on audio and visual media.  All this work can be viewed at the following address: http://aerophagics.com/aerophagics-contemporary.html
I am currently seeking funding to produce a soapbox derby racer of a Delahaye 135M.  If this soapbox derby racer is produced, it will enable me to take part in various soapbox championships in Europe and the world.  Most people who make soapbox derby racers think only of such aspects as aerodynamics, weight and speed.  For its part, aerophagics prefers to focus on such aspects as appearance, shape and visual impact.  In fact, although this project is a virtual gallery, it is still a project that enables me to reflect on the question of entrepreneurship and its dominant form today:  the company.  I have drawn myself all the plans needed to build the soapbox derby racer using an AutoCAD software.  I have created 3D images using the 4D cinema software.  Having no skills to build the soapbox derby racer, I have turned to a former world champion in the field who has the technical tools and expertise to see the project through.  He agrees to make the soapbox and was very impressed by the finesse of the plans I produced.  As he has a numeric control device, the 3D plans that I produced using AutoCAD will enable us to make a true to scale polystyrene mould, i.e. 309 cm x 129 cm x 51 cm.  Once the mould has been produced, we are going to use it to make the body in fibreglass.  To reduce costs, I will see to all the finishing works (painting, lettering, etc.).
 These €15,000 will be used to
Produce the soapbox derby racer true to scale  Build the bodywork. Build the chassis  Finishing (painting, seat, etc..)
Produce two suits with the colours of aerophagics
Produce two helmets with the colours of aerophagics
I will assume the transport costs to participate in the first events.
If the funds I raise are not sufficient to see this project through I will reinvest them in a publication project I am pursuing with a group of young Brussels artists.
 
If you want to see the plans I have produced, you can contact me using the following form: http://www.aerophagics.com/contact.html
I thank you in advance for your kind attention and always at your entire disposal, I remain
Cordially yours
 
 
Jeune artiste diplômé de l’ArBA-esa de Bruxelles, je suis actuellement assistant conférencier dans l’atelier (AesP) au sein du même établissement. Cette fonction consiste à accompagner les démarches artistiques des étudiants, dans le cadre d’ateliers créatifs  et d’apprentissage de logiciels autour de la question de l’image réelle (captation vidéo)/virtuelle (modélisation 3D) en mouvement.
aerophagics contemporary est une galerie d’art fictive. Sur le web, elle questionne la visibilité et la communication des institutions, des galeries et des acteurs du champ de l’art. À la manière d’un sémionaute, elle trace une critique des réseaux sociaux et du marché de l’art.Le marché de l’art est basé sur l’exclusion, car il se concentre uniquement sur quelques noms qui deviennent des produits dont les valeurs artistiques évoluent au profit du marché. J ‘ai eu la volonté de créer ma propre ‘écurie’ en lui attribuant un nom et un logo : aerophagics contemporary. Pour la réalisation de ce positionnement, j’ai crée une page facebook et un sticker éponyme collé sur la vitrine des locaux  pendant une résidence d’artiste  à Ixelles.  aerophagics contemporary a été reprise, par opportunité, sur la page web de la commune d’Ixelles et répertoriée comme étant une galerie d’art implanté sur son territoire. aerophagics contemporary s’en est retrouvée officialisée, institutionnalisée, ou du moins, sa visibilité ‘sur la place de l’art’ était désormais acquise. Ce qui faisait apparence ou illusion, d’une galerie d’art, du moins extérieurement, prenait statut de réalité.
En partenariat avec l’atelier AEsP de L’ArBA-Esa de Bruxelles, j’ai partagé ce projet en (2009-2010) avec les étudiants de cet atelier. Ils ont crée des avatars sur des réseaux sociaux tels que Facebook, LinkedIn et Twitter, en caractérisant les archétypes des identités du "bon" fonctionnement d’une galerie au travers des postures figurées par des employés, des artistes, des collectionneurs d'aerophagics contemporary. Ce montage, entrepreneurial fictif, a donné lieu à des simulacres de discussions (échanges mails) entre avatars collectionneurs et artistes non fictifs. Pour ne pas en rester à une fausse parodie trompeuse, de l'offre et la demande, de véritables fictions d'artistes se sont progressivement constituées  par des productions artistiques et des identités construites (biographies, profils & contextes historiques, questionnements sur l'art, débats philosophiques etc.) pour aboutir à de véritables identités, autonomes, qui, aujourd'hui encore, continuent à évoluer dans l'espace cybernétique par la modélisation de l'échange et de l'information et par le billet, des principes d'interaction. Certaines de ces fictions ont été consignées sur des supports sonores et visuels. Tout ce travail est visible à l’adresse suivante : http://aerophagics.com/aerophagics-contemporary.html
Actuellement je suis à la recherche d’un financement pour réaliser une caisse à savon d’une Delahaye 135M.  Si cette caisse à savon est produite, elle me permettra de participer à plusieurs événement  autours des championnats d’europe et du monde de caisse à savon. La plupart des gens qui réalise des caisses à savon ne pense uniquement à l’aspect aerodynamique, poid, vitesse. Aerophagics préfère elle penser à l’aspect forme, esthétique et impact visuelle. En effet bien que ce projet soit une galerie virtuelle, il n’en n’est pas moins un projet qui me permet de refléchir sur la question de l’entreprenariat et de sa forme dominante aujourd’hui : l’entreprise. J’ai déssiné moi même tous les plans nécessaires à la réalisation de la caisse à savon via le logiciel autocad. J’ai réalisé des rendus images 3D via le logiciel cinéma 4D. N'ayant aucune compétence pour la réalisation de la caisse à savon j’ai fait appel à un ancien champion du monde dans le domaine qui possède le savoir et l’outillage technique pour mener à bien le projet. Il est d'accord pour produire la caisse et a été très impréssionné par la finesse des plans que j’ai réalisé. Etant donné qu’il possède une commande numérique, les plans 3D que j’ai réalisé via autocad vont nous permettre de réaliser un moule en polystyrène à échelle. C’est à dire de 309cmx 129cmx 51cm. Une fois ce moule réalisé nous allons nous en servir pour réaliser la carosserie en fibre de verre. Pour réduire les coûts  je prends en charge toutes les finitions (peinture, lettrage...) Ces 15000 euros serviront à
Produire la caisse à savon à echelle 1 Réalisation de la carosserie. Réalisation du chassis  Finition (peinture, sticker, banquette etc..)
Réalisation de deux combinaisons aux couleurs d’aerophagics
Réalisation de deux casques aux couleurs d’aerophagics
Prise en charge des coûts de transport pour participer aux premiers évènements.
Si les fonds que je récolte ne me permettent pas de réaliser ce projet je les réinvestisserai dans un projet de publication que je mène à bein avec un collectif de jeunes artistes bruxellois.
 
Si vous désirez voir les plans que j'ai réalisé vous pouvez me contacter via le formulaire suivant : http://www.aerophagics.com/contact.html
En vous remerciant de l’accueil que vous ferez à ma proposition et restant à votre entière disposition.
Cordialement

story:
** scroll down for English version **

CHE COS'E' [TRP] TREVIGLIOPOESIA

[TRP] è un progetto nato sette anni fa come una sfida tra amici appassionati di poesia e video. "Perché non creiamo nella nostra città un festival dedicato alla poesia e alla videopoesia?". La risposta è stata [TRP] Trevigliopoesia. Un festival di poesia e di videopoesia, appunto. Ma non solo.

In questi anni [TRP] è diventato anche un luogo in cui la parola poetica si confronta con la fotografia, il teatro, la musica, la danza, la filosofia: all'insegna della contaminazione, del confronto fra la poesia e gli altri linguaggi, artistici e non.

E infine [TRP] ha iniziato a condurre una vera e propria guerriglia poetica, attraverso azioni di performance art urbana, per riappropriarsi poeticamente degli spazi cittadini liberando la creatività e lottando contro la dittatura del meccanismo automatico, che imprigiona i nostri giorni e uccide la poesia.

 

CHE COSA TI CHIEDIAMO

In tutti questi anni [TRP] è riuscito a sostenersi grazie a sponsor privati e istituzionali, primo fra tutti il Comune di Treviglio. Ora, in questo periodo di forte crisi economica, [TRP] chiede anche il tuo aiuto per continuare a esistere e resistere.

Lo chiede a te che ci hai seguito con interesse e affetto fin dal primo momento: per regalarti un'edizione, quella di quest'anno, all'altezza delle precedenti e speriamo migliore. Il tuo aiuto sarà per noi un motivo per impegnarci ancora di più.

E lo chiede a te che non ci conosci, perché la tua mano tesa possa essere l'inizio di una lunga amicizia. Ci impegneremo per non deludere la tua scommessa su di noi.

L'obiettivo che ci poniamo è raccogliere, grazie al tuo aiuto, 3.000 €. Tale cifra servirà a coprire alcune spese fondamentali (come quelle per gli ospiti e la comunicazione) per l'edizione 2013 del festival, che si svolgerà a Treviglio (BG) dal 24 maggio al 2 giugno. 

 

COME VOGLIAMO RINGRAZIARTI

Per ringraziarti del tuo contributo ti invieremo un piccolo dono pensato appositamente per te: una cartolina di [TRP] a tiratura limitata firmata da tutti i componenti dello staff. E poi, a seconda di quanto potrai donarci, la shopper ufficiale di [TRP] e libri degli autori presenti all'edizione di quest'anno, autografati per te.

Puoi scegliere quanto donare e cosa ricevere nei box a destra di questa pagina.

 

ALTRI MODI PER AIUTARCI

Se non hai la possibilità di sostenerci economicamente, non ti preoccupare, ti capiamo! Ma se ti piace il nostro progetto, ti chiediamo di aiutarci a diffondere fra i tuoi amici la notizia di questa campagna. Lo puoi fare usando gli strumenti di condivisione che Indiegogo mette a disposizione e che trovi in alto in questa pagina.

 

PER CONTATTI

Per qualsiasi dubbio, informazione o altro, non esitare a contattarci all'indirizzo: associazionenuvole@yahoo.it

Ti invitiamo inoltre a visitare il sito del festival www.trevigliopoesia.it, il nostro archivio online dedicato alla videopoesia www.videopoesia.org e le nostre pagine facebook e twitter.

 

English version

WHAT IS [TRP] TREVIGLIOPOESIA

[TRP] is a project born seven years ago as a challenge between friends with a passion for poetry and video making. “Why don’t we organize in our city a festival dedicated to poetry and videopoetry?”. The answer to that was, and still is, [TRP]Trevigliopoesia. A festival of poetry and videopoetry, indeed. But that’s not all it is.

Through the years [TRP] has become a place in which the poetic word compares itself with photography, theatre, music, dance, philosophy: all in the pursuit of contamination and comparison between poetry and other languages, whether artistic or not.

And ultimately, [TRP] started to lead an out-and-out poeticguerrilla, through actions of urban art performance, to poetically repossess the city spaces, setting free creativity and fighting against the dictatorship of the automatic mechanism, that cages our days and eventually kills poetry.

 

WHAT WE ASK OF YOU

In all these past years [TRP] managed to sustain itself thanks to both private and institutional sponsors, starting from the Municipality of Treviglio. Now, in this period of strong economic recession, [TRP] calls also for your help to continue to exist and resist.

It asks for help to you, who followed us all with such interest and affection from day one: to give you an edition –the one taking place this year- up to the standards of the previous ones, possibly even better. Your help will be for us a solid reason to work even harder.

And it asks for help to you, who don’t know us yet, so that your helping hand could be the beginning of a long friendship. We will work very hard to not disappoint your bet on us.

The goal we set is to reach, thanks to your help, 3.000 €. This amount will serve to cover some fundamental expenses (such as the guests and the communication campaign) for the 2013 edition of the festival, which will take place in Treviglio (BG) from May the 24th to June the 2nd.


HOW TO THANK YOU

To thank you for your contribution we will send you a small gift, thought specifically for you: a postcard of [TRP] in limited edition, signed by all the components of the staff. And then, based on what you will be able to donate us, the official shopper of [TRP] and books by the authors that will be featured in this year’s edition, with their autograph just for you. You can choose how much to donate and what to receive in the box on the right of this page.

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP US

If you don’t have the possibility to sustain us economically, don’t worry, we understand you! But if you happen to like our project, then we would ask you to help us spreading to all your friends the word and the meaning of this campaign. You can do it by using the sharing tools that Indiegogo features on top of the page.

 

CONTACTS

Should you have any doubt, need of clarification or information, do not hesitate to contact us! You can find us at associazionenuvole@yahoo.it

We also invite you to visit the website of the festival www.trevigliopoesia.it, our online archive dedicated to videopoetry www.videopoesia.org and our facebook and twitter pages.

story:
My name is Erin and I'm a portrait artist living in Pennsylvania. I am trying to raise money to send a painting I spent months on to London for the BP Portrait Competition. The BP Portrait Competition is one of the biggest portrait competitions of the year. The first prize is 30,000 euro and even to make it into the show as a finalist is an honor that can open doors for you. It is international so submissions are received from all over and I want so so badly to be able to compete. I have submitted my entry already, but the competition requires you send the painting to the venue for judging to get into the show. When I looked up specs for air freight to London (sea would have been cheaper, but would have taken too long and I wouldn't have made the deadline) my lowest quote (out of MANY) was $1,200.00 :( I was not anticipating such a high shipping rate.

 

For those of you who may or may not know me, I recently started my own small business in November of 2012. Although I have experienced some moderate success in the last few months of being open, every dollar I make is still being invested right back into the business. I simply do not have the financial wiggle room to be able to spend $1,200.00 on shipping in light of the other overhead expenses I have running my business.

 

Still, I am a stubborn S.O.B. and I'm not willing to throw in the towel just yet. I could not think of any other avenues to raise the money to send this painting, so I am appealing to those who may like my work and would like to give me my shot in London. Please, please, PLEASE every little bit helps!!!!!

story:
Watch the video above from Capt Flipper Manchester and see some great footage of Christina's history and her future! 

Short Summary

The Christina was rescued from Lake Tahoe in 2010, and repurposed as an Art Car by Capt Flipper Manchester.  He funded the entire project personally with no outside donations.  It costs over $15,000 a year just to maintain, store, insure, and operarate her on the playa.   This year, she is in desperate need of repair, upgrades, and help to fade some of the costs of operations.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $30,000 this year.  Here's the breakdown.

$12,500 New amps, speakers, and labor to install additional sound and repair

$2,500 in annual storage fee

$5,000 in fuel costs

$5,000 in labor, tickets, and housing and food for real employees to run her during the festival.  These are sober, non-partying people hired to operate her for optimal safety.

$2,500 for upgrade on paint and new lighting

$2,500 for fire effect and propane. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Pleae share this campagin through your social networks, email lists, etc. 

You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Rust Belt Books is not only a great bookstore, but it has also been a home for art and artists in Buffalo, New York, for over a decade.  At Rust Belt, it has always been a given that art is more about the creative process and engaging an audience than it is about buying and selling.

For over a decade, Rust Belt Books has been home to the (original) Real Dream Cabaret, and the first home for numerous theater companies, including Blue Garrote, Brazen Faced Varlets, and Subversive Theater, some of which have gone on to find larger and more  permanent homes elsewhere.

The caretakers of Rust Belt Books, Kristi and Erin (and previously Brian), have provided space for visual artists to show their work, performance artists to try out new ideas, poets to share their words, puppeteers to bring their work to life, playwrights to become theater directors, actors and comedians to hone their craft, and musicians to share their music.  It has been a place where artists can bring their work to life.  In Rust Belt's short history, there have been political meetings and media stunts, musical performances, experimental theater productions, art installations, art exhibits, and improvisational sketch comedy.

Rust Belt Books has not only been a bookstore with an excellent selection of used books; it has not only  been a performance space; it has been a community space and a fertile meeting ground for area artists, writers, comedians, playwrights, and musicians.

In the next month, through the amazing efforts of its proprietors and caretakers, Rust Belt Books will be moving to its new home at 415 Grant Street, to begin its next incarnation.  We would like to give Rust Belt a monetary gift to help ease this transition and help Kristi and Erin continue the legacy.
story_txt: Rust Belt Books is not only a great bookstore, but it has also been a home for art and artists in Buffalo, New York, for over a decade.  At Rust Belt, it has always been a given that art is more about the creative process and engaging an audience than it is about buying and selling.For over a decade, Rust Belt Books has been home to the (original) Real Dream Cabaret, and the first home for numerous theater companies, including Blue Garrote, Brazen Faced Varlets, and Subversive Theater, some of which have gone on to find larger and more  permanent homes elsewhere.The caretakers of Rust Belt Books, Kristi and Erin (and previously Brian), have provided space for visual artists to show their work, performance artists to try out new ideas, poets to share their words, puppeteers to bring their work to life, playwrights to become theater directors, actors and comedians to hone their craft, and musicians to share their music.  It has been a place where artists can bring their work to life.  In Rust Belt's short history, there have been political meetings and media stunts, musical performances, experimental theater productions, art installations, art exhibits, and improvisational sketch comedy.Rust Belt Books has not only been a bookstore with an excellent selection of used books; it has not only  been a performance space; it has been a community space and a fertile meeting ground for area artists, writers, comedians, playwrights, and musicians.In the next month, through the amazing efforts of its proprietors and caretakers, Rust Belt Books will be moving to its new home at 415 Grant Street, to begin its next incarnation.  We would like to give Rust Belt a monetary gift to help ease this transition and help Kristi and Erin continue the legacy.

story:
BuildingBloc

Bloc Projects is an artist-led gallery space. Established in 2002 in Sheffield, the gallery sits in a complex of former steel-working buildings, home to Bloc Studios and its artists and makers. We don’t draw any income from this community, but rent our space within them. Over our 13 years we have welcomed thousands of guests and supported hundreds of early and mid career artists, through exhibitions, performance events, screenings, talk, workshops, mentoring sessions, gigs, parties, fetes and more.

In 2014, faced with funding problems and closure, we took the decision to expand our premises to offer a better standard of facilities and increase our ability to bring in much needed funds. After considering moving to a new site, we decided to remain as part of the Bloc Studios community and keep cultural activity in an historic part of the city that is undergoing change through demolition and development.

We were successful in raising most of the funds needed to enable us to undertake a small-scale build project. We have expanded the original squared gallery and are currently in the process of creating on-street access. Although we have raised and sourced the majority of the funding, we need your help to finish the process.


What we'll do with the funds

A total of £3000 will enable us to add disability access, toilets, a small shop area, improved storage, office space and a more visible frontage.

An additional £2000 will give us further improvements, making the gallery able to be easily blacked out for events such as screenings and performances, and providing us with better and more energy efficient lighting.

All our work meets building regulations and is done with the support of Sheffield-based architecture social enterprise Studio Polpo.


Thank you! 

We greatly appreciate any support you can offer our project - every contribution helps. Read below for details of what we'll give you in return!

If you can't donate but would like to support us in another way, get in touch.

Thank you!

The Bloc Projects team

#buildingbloc - Here's our website - Here we are on Twitter - Facebook - Instagram


** Rewards **


  • £3 - Thank you for supporting the project! You'll have your name and link featured on our website supporters page.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

  • £15 - Receive an invitation to our VIP grand opening reception with food and drinks and get your name and website link on our website.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
  • £25 - You'll get an invitation to our VIP grand opening reception with food and drinks, your name and website link will feature on our website and we'll send you a special limited edition artist-designed card!

The card design is a surprise! So pictured is one of our great billboards from 2015 by Helen de Main.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

  • £40 - You are invited to attend a special silk screen printing demonstration with artist and wallpaper designer Sarah Jane Palmer!

    See how her repeat pattern works are made and gain advice on setting out to make your own prints. Plus you'll receive an invitation to our VIP grand opening reception with food and drinks, a limited edition artist-designed card and your name and link on our website.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

  • £45 - You are invited to attend a book-binding workshop with artist Victoria Lucas! Each participant will create a selection of books to take home, including concertina book and a Japanese stab binding - all materials provided. You'll also get an invitation to our VIP grand opening reception with food and drinks, a limited edition artist-designed card and your name and link on our website.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

  • £50 - Get a specially produced risograph print by one of the Bloc Projects team of artists, both staff and board. Plus an invitation to our VIP grand opening reception with food and drinks, a limited edition artist-designed card and your name and link on our website!

Example works by Dominic Mason, Victoria Lucas and Charlotte Morgan. Full list of works coming soon!

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

  • £80 - Receive one of our beautuful editions by Graeme Durant, Dust, Dale Holmes, Rebecca Lennon or Louisa Martin! Plus of course an invitation to our VIP grand opening reception with food and drinks, a limited edition artist-designed card and your name and link on our website.



Pictured: Works by Louisa Martin, Rebecca Lennon and Dale Holmes, clockwise from top left. Full selection available.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

  • £100 - Use our gallery space for one day, perfect for photoshoots, gigs, events, workshops and more. You'll also receive the VIP invitation, card and mention on our website!

Pictured: MSB residency exchange workshop, 2015.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

  • £400 - Make the most of a whole week in our gallery space at a huge discount! Dates are flexible. Perfect for exhibitions, pop-up projects, residencies and more. You'll also get an invitation to our VIP grand opening reception with food and drinks, a limited edition artist-designed card and your name and link on our website.

Pictured: One Great Workshop, a Sheffield Design Week and AHRC Connected Communities Festival project by Stories of Change.

story:
WATCH THE ENGLISH VERSION http://www.indiegogo.com/licenzaditortura?c=gal...

NELLA GALLERY IL VIDEO IN INGLESE http://www.indiegogo.com/licenzaditortura?c=gal...

 

Mi chiamo Claudia Guido, ho 29 anni, sono laureata in fotografia e vivo in Italia.

Ci sono cose nel mio paese che non mi piacciono e ho deciso, un anno e mezzo fa, di provarci, di smetterla di lamentarmi per poi andare a dormire, svegliarmi e ricominciare a lamentarmi.
Ho deciso di fare quello che so fare meglio, di utilizzare la fotografia e l’arte come mezzo per dire ciò che penso e lottare per ciò in cui credo.
Uno degli aspetti  che più mi colpiscono, è la mancanza del reato di tortura in Italia. Il mio governo 25 anni fa ha firmato il trattato con l’Onu ma non l’ha applicato. Eppure il reato c’è e ne ho le prove.
Carlo Giuliani è il ragazzo che venne ucciso durante il g8 del 2001 a Genova. La sua morte non ha aperto nessun capitolo giudiziario, non ha avuto un processo, da allora le forze dell’ordine italiane hanno capito di poter uccidere  rimanendo impuniti.
Ne sanno qualcosa Haidi Giuliani e Giuliano Giuliani, i genitori di Carlo : nella loro battaglia hanno insegnato agli altri familiari delle vittime delle forze dell’ordine che si può e si deve lottare per arrivare alla verità, anche se arrivare alla giustizia a volte è impossibile, altre è complicato e doloroso.
Fu una lettera di Haidi Giuliani scritta a Patrizia Moretti, mamma di Federico Aldrovandi, a darle la spinta  per cominciare un percorso processuale lungo 7 anni e appena concluso. Patrizia Moretti, ha dato l’esempio a sua volta a Ilaria Cucchi, sorella di Stefano Cucchi. Poi è arrivata Lucia Uva, e poi Rudra Bianzino, Giuliana Rasman, Paolo Scaroni, Luciano Isidro Diaz, Stefano Gugliotta, Domenica Ferrulli, Grazia Serra.
Voglio presentarvi queste persone e le loro undici famiglie, voglio farvi vedere che contrariamente a quanto avete letto, ascoltato e visto in televisione, sono persone ordinarie, talmente normali da essere esattamente uguali a voi, come lo erano i loro familiari uccisi. Voglio raccontarvi queste storie mostrandovi 20 ritratti che ho realizzato in un anno e mezzo di lavoro, di viaggi, di incontri, di amicizie, di lacrime, di dolore; 20 volti in cui potrete riconoscervi, potrete vedere dove si consuma la tortura in questo paese e ritrovarla nei loro occhi.
 
I sopravvissuti ai pestaggi:
Luciano Isidro Diaz
Stefano Gugliotta
Paolo Scaroni
I sopravvissuti alla morte dei propri figli, o genitori, o fratelli:
Le famiglie di:
Carlo Giuliani
Federico Aldrovandi 
Stefano Cucchi 
Giuseppe Uva 
Aldo Bianzino
Riccardo Rasman,
Franco Mastrogiovanni
Michele Ferrulli 
 
Se mi aiuterete finanziando il mio progetto, potrò portare in giro queste fotografie, insieme alle loro storie. Potrò presentarvi queste famiglie nella speranza che un giorno lottiate con me al loro fianco, perché è solo un caso che non sia successo a noi, invece che a loro.
 
Ho chiesto un finanziamento di $4900 (4000 €) dei quali:
-2000 € saranno usati per le stampe delle fotografie, i pannelli, l'allestimento della mostra e le spese di trasporto delle opere.
-2000 € saranno usati per la produzione di un catalogo che raccolga tutte le fotografie. (SOLO NEL CASO IN CUI RAGGIUNGA LA CIFRA NECESSARIA)
 
 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

 

My name is Claudia Guido, I’m 29 years old, I’m graduated in Photography and I live in Italy.
There are things in my country which I don’t like so I decided one year and a half ago to try and stop complaining just for the sake of complaining, go to bed at night, wake up in the morning and start complaining again.
I decided to do what I best know, to use photography and art to say what I think and fight for what I believe in.
One of the things that shocks me the most is the lack of justice for torture crime in Italy. Twenty-five years ago my government signed the treaty with ONU but did not apply it. And yet the crime is there and I’ve got  proof of it.
Carlo Giuliani is the young man who got killed during the G8 of 2001 in Genova. Nojudicial section has been opened after his death, he had no trial, since then the Italian law enforcement understood it could kill without being punished.
Haidi and Giuliano Giuliani, Carlo’s parents, know something about it: with their battle they taught the other law enforcement victims’ families that they can and must fightto reach the truth, although reaching justice is sometimes impossible, other times complicated and distressing.
It was a letter written by Haidi Giuliani to Patrzia Moretti, Federico Aldrovandi’s mother, which induced her to start a procedural course of action lasted seven years and just concluded. Patrizia Moretti gave example in turn to Ilaria Cucchi, Stefano Cucchi’s sister. Then Lucia Uva came, and after them Rudra Bianzino, Giuliana Rasman, Paolo Scaroni, Luciano Isidro Diaz, Stefano Gugliotta, Domenica Ferrulli, Grazia Serra.
I want to introduce you to these people and their families, I want to show you that, in contrast with what you’ve read, heard and seen on television, they’re ordinary people, so normal to be exactly the same as you, as were their family members killed. I want to tell you these stories showing you twenty portraits I realized in one year and a half of work, travels, meetings, friendships, tears, grief; twenty faces with whom you might identify, see where torture consumes in this country and recover it in their eyes.

The survivors to beatings:
Luciano Isidro Diaz
Stefano Gugliotta
Paolo Scaroni
The survivors to the death of their own sons, or parents, or brothers:
The families of:
Carlo Giuliani
Federico Aldrovandi
Stefano Cucchi
Giuseppe Uva
Aldo Bianzino
Riccardo Rasman
Franco Mastrogiovanni
Michele Ferrulli

If you’ll help me by financing my project, I can carry around these photographs, together with their stories. I can introduce you to these families in the hope that one day you’ll fight with me, alongside them, because it’s just a coincidence it happened to them, instead of us.

My founding goal is $4900:

-$2450 will be used for the printing of the photographs, to mount the exibition, transport expenses of the photographs.

-$2450 will be used for the printing of the catalogue (IF I REACH THE FOUND GOAL)

story:
It's the year 2016, and the world has been overtaken by neon-clad renegades starving for sustenance and comfort in a land full of desire, self-discovery, and radical transformation. The New Barbarians roam the dusty horizon aboard their massive steed, Jurassic Pork, on a quest to spread its bountiful stock of flesh surrendered by pastured hogs.  The only hope for the few remaining survivors living amongst the playa is to join a never-ending feast suitable for King Horik himself as we share amongst the generosity of our humble leader, JP, and amalgamate ever closer to becoming one.
 

Dear Burners & Friends,

The New Barbarians are here to welcome you to our first Jurassic Pork Fundraiser! This is our third year bringing sustenance and endless comfort in a desert land full of desire, self-discovery, and radical transformation. Among other gifts, we deliver nourishment in the form of tasty sausages to the mouths of any hungry souls we meet during feeding time. We need your help to ensure that Jurassic Pork, our art car that is our means of delivering meaty (and vegetarian) fare beyond the realms of our camp, will be fit and tough enough to travel around the playa, rescuing hungry and wretched burners from near-starvation.

We are... 

a group of 30+ strong from around the world, working to construct a camp at 7:30 & A that will feature the following events and amenities for all to enjoy:

  • Sausage sizzles at 1-2pm every day, made complete with delicious DJ sessions to boogie and chow down to on our large, shaded, carpeted dance floor and couch lounge area.
  • Tuesday night fiesta featuring special guest DJs, live painting, and sausages galore
  • 2-story tower with shade, hammocks & cargo net lounging and glorious views of sunrises, sunsets and everything in between
  • Dome, art, handmade jewelry gifts, yoga, and much more!

We ask for your help in funding various repairs and improvements to Jurassic Pork, our beloved art car.

Jurassic Pork... 

was created after many of the New Barbarians' first burn, and as a response to the crucial mid-playa snacks which had sustained the weary explorers. An art car was not enough; we had to bring food to the people. Jurassic Pork was built to sizzle sausage, and haul our juicy meat, post-apocalyptic stragglers, and of course, our collective wiener lovesack. 

We've learned over the last two years that the best way to get wieners in and around as many mouths as possible is by making our bbq mobile, posting up near burns or parties and firing up  the grill or by teaming up with other camps to host large events.

In addition to wiener-fying these events, we plan to continue making spontaneous sausage safaris all around the playa, including to the most remote and harrowing regions and in the wee hours of the morning, to surprise hungry burners with the most needed, yet unplanned-for nourishment!

Two seasons of sausage slanging have taken their toll on our beloved JP. The dino diagnosis from our Barbarian docs is that the following repairs, improvements, and support are needed in order to ensure a healthy and glorious third run of spreading wiener love all across the playa:

  • New electrical wiring, light sequencer, and LED strip lights to illuminate the beast and catch the attention of deliriously starving burners (two years of fun has taken its toll)
  • New air filter
  • New generator (last year’s ate too much playa)
  • Engine tune-up
  • A new tire
  • And last but not least…. WIENERS!!! We hope to bring at least 2000 more gourmet meat and vegetable sausages this year!

We invite you to support our dusty savage nourishment project by making a contribution to the Jurassic Pork fund – it will be appreciated by not only us New Barbarians, but by every hungry playa dweller who enjoys an extra boost from our wieners. You can also help us by getting the word out on our campaign to reach as many people as possible.

Thank you! From the bottom of our hearts, we love you and can't wait to see you out there.

Love and Dust, 
The New Barbarians
story_txt:
It's the year 2016, and the world has been overtaken by neon-clad renegades starving for sustenance and comfort in a land full of desire, self-discovery, and radical transformation. The New Barbarians roam the dusty horizon aboard their massive steed, Jurassic Pork, on a quest to spread its bountiful stock of flesh surrendered by pastured hogs.  The only hope for the few remaining survivors living amongst the playa is to join a never-ending feast suitable for King Horik himself as we share amongst the generosity of our humble leader, JP, and amalgamate ever closer to becoming one. 
Dear Burners & Friends,
The New Barbarians are here to welcome you to our first Jurassic Pork Fundraiser! This is our third year bringing sustenance and endless comfort in a desert land full of desire, self-discovery, and radical transformation. Among other gifts, we deliver nourishment in the form of tasty sausages to the mouths of any hungry souls we meet during feeding time. We need your help to ensure that Jurassic Pork, our art car that is our means of delivering meaty (and vegetarian) fare beyond the realms of our camp, will be fit and tough enough to travel around the playa, rescuing hungry and wretched burners from near-starvation.


We are... 
a group of 30+ strong from around the world, working to construct a camp at 7:30 & A that will feature the following events and amenities for all to enjoy:

Sausage sizzles at 1-2pm every day, made complete with delicious DJ sessions to boogie and chow down to on our large, shaded, carpeted dance floor and couch lounge area.
Tuesday night fiesta featuring special guest DJs, live painting, and sausages galore
2-story tower with shade, hammocks & cargo net lounging and glorious views of sunrises, sunsets and everything in between
Dome, art, handmade jewelry gifts, yoga, and much more!

We ask for your help in funding various repairs and improvements to Jurassic Pork, our beloved art car.

Jurassic Pork... 
was created after many of the New Barbarians' first burn, and as a response to the crucial mid-playa snacks which had sustained the weary explorers. An art car was not enough; we had to bring food to the people. Jurassic Pork was built to sizzle sausage, and haul our juicy meat, post-apocalyptic stragglers, and of course, our collective wiener lovesack. We've learned over the last two years that the best way to get wieners in and around as many mouths as possible is by making our bbq mobile, posting up near burns or parties and firing up  the grill or by teaming up with other camps to host large events.In addition to wiener-fying these events, we plan to continue making spontaneous sausage safaris all around the playa, including to the most remote and harrowing regions and in the wee hours of the morning, to surprise hungry burners with the most needed, yet unplanned-for nourishment!


Two seasons of sausage slanging have taken their toll on our beloved JP. The dino diagnosis from our Barbarian docs is that the following repairs, improvements, and support are needed in order to ensure a healthy and glorious third run of spreading wiener love all across the playa:

New electrical wiring, light sequencer, and LED strip lights to illuminate the beast and catch the attention of deliriously starving burners (two years of fun has taken its toll)
New air filter
New generator (last year’s ate too much playa)
Engine tune-up
A new tire
And last but not least…. WIENERS!!! We hope to bring at least 2000 more gourmet meat and vegetable sausages this year!


We invite you to support our dusty savage nourishment project by making a contribution to the Jurassic Pork fund – it will be appreciated by not only us New Barbarians, but by every hungry playa dweller who enjoys an extra boost from our wieners. You can also help us by getting the word out on our campaign to reach as many people as possible.
Thank you! From the bottom of our hearts, we love you and can't wait to see you out there.
Love and Dust, The New Barbarians

story:
Our Story

My name is Rhiannon D'Averc, and I am in my final year of studying a BA in Photography at the University of Hertfordshire. I have recently been offered the chance to put on a joint exhibition (along with fellow student Ila Desai) at The Castle, Wellingborough. This is my first exhibition, and as I am simultaneously working on prints for my degree exhibition, I need to raise money to cover the expenses of the shoots (paying models and MUAs, making test prints, and making the final prints).

 

The exhibition is titled 'Youth in Bloom'. Combining the idea of a flower bursting into it's first bloom with that of a young model coming into their first real flush of life and success, the images are vibrant and full of life. The models stare out with a gaze that both challenges you and invites you to enjoy life in the way they so clearly do.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The figure of £320 will cover expenses as follows (approximate $ values in brackets):

Hahnemuhle paper for printing - £65 ($103.08)

Test prints - £10 ($15.86)

Printing costs (ie ink, use of printer, wall fastenings etc) - £50 ($79.24)

MUA travel expenses - £30 ($47.58)

Model travel expenses - £70 ($111.08)

Props - £25 ($39.67)

Literature (list of contributors and sponsors, models' names, about the artist) - £45 ($71.4)

Getting to the gallery to hang work and attend opening night - £25 ($39.67)

 

Any money raised above the target will be put towards improving the quality of the exhibition. Significant contributors can request a mention in literature placed at the exhibition space (money raised above the goal could also be put towards the production of a leaflet or blurb listing contributors and sponsors).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the campaign, spread the word about the exhibition, and even come down and have a look when we open in April!

 

I am also selling prints and other items on my redbubble account to raise money. You can view my account here!

story:
We are a trio of young artists, creating work

with an emphasis on mental health,

personal narrative, humor, and community.

 

We are building a production company based on our values of health, art, and community and our first project is a show blending stand-up comedy, poetry, and storytelling that we will take touring to universities around the country. Once there, we will also work with students to get them engaged in their own personal narratives through workshops, office hours, and showcases.

Our hope is that this project will not only help us sustain ourselves as artists, but also give us an avenue toward creating lasting artistic community on campuses across the U.S. As we tour, we bring with us our sense of community and our values: the destigmatizing of mental health, the healing power of laughter and dialogue, and the idea that every person has a story to tell and that they deserve to be given the space to tell it.

 

 

Art and expression should be a human right.

To speak, to be heard, and to feel safe doing so.

 

Community is not as simple as sitting in a room with other people like us. In fact, we’ve often found ourselves most nurtured by sharing our experiences with those who are not like us, who have other, different stories to tell that help us expand our perspective. When we listen to each other, we are able to find a deeper commonality in spite of our differences, one that allows us to support each other meaningfully which is not the same as always agreeing.

 

 

What does it mean to start a movement?

 

If we want to be successful we need to be moving in several directions at once:

  • Electronic press kit, a digital portfolio used as both publicity and as an informational tool for clients and collaborators
  • General marketing and advertisement to start bringing in clients via traditional means
  • Trial workshops to help us refine how we approach creating effective collaborative spaces for students and not to lose sight of the human and community side of things
  • Business cards and domain name for our website in order to network outside of our own communities

 

 

We are growing our company and our

community. Grow with us.

 

When you donate to us, when you support us in any way, you are helping us carry these beliefs into being-- helping us work to shape a world where there is an insistence on struggling together, on respecting each other, and on creating meaningful art.

This is our first round of fundraising. If we meet these goals, we will be able to start looking toward funding our next steps. There is so much more that we want to do, so much work that we believe is essential, especially now, but we want to start small and stay humble. We want to make sure that if this becomes real and blossoms into something larger than we expect, it is because you all believe in it as deeply as we do.

We understand that not everyone can donate financially to this campaign, but that does not mean that that is the only way you can contribute. We would be immensely grateful if you shared our story and our campaign with your communities. Any action you take means the world to us.

 

 

 

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us as monomythproductions@gmail.com. Our website is mostly up and running, so please also browse that for more information. Thank you!

story:
Sabian Symbol

(Scorpio 16) A GIRL’S FACE BREAKING INTO A SMILE.

Keynote: The fervent reaching out on the part of the young at heart to new experiences.

Short Summary

Welcome to the Sabian Symbols Collaborative Online Art Project supporting the Evolution of Consciousness. This is an exciting and ambitious project. Collectively, we will create an extraordinary experiment in the evolution of consciousness through a collaborative art project. Everyone is encouraged to participate.

The Sabian Symbols correspond to the 360 degrees of the Zodiac. These symbols are sacred to astrologers and used to promote understanding of human potential and the evolution of consciousness. These symbols relate to us individually through the soul, anima/animus, or the collective unconscious.

Scope of Project - First Phase

I have created a basic website with a historical summary of the Sabian Symbols, additional information about myself and this project. Sabian Art will serve as the platform for collaboration in the creation of the Sabian Symbol Images.

The process of creative collaboration: a Sabian Symbol will be posted every month, for one month. Artists, writers, photographers, visionaries, astrologers, and all creatives are encouraged to participate in the creation of the image. A photo, an image, an illustration, word(s), whatever resonates from their soul in relation to the symbol. Thus the collaboration begins. The only requirement is that all work submitted must be the original work of the artist.

From the collective works submitted by our creatives who are tuned into their soul, spirit and the collective unconscious, an image will be created by me to visually represent each Sabian Symbol.

As an example of the creative potential of this project, the image above is my original award-winning work, below, is the Sabian Symbol for 16 degree of Scorpio.

Scope of Project - Second Phase (may involve a second Indiegogo campaign)

After the initial 12 Sabian Symbol Images are created, a traveling art exhibition will be produced, contracted and shown throughout the US and potentially abroad.

All submitted work that is used in each Sabian Symbol Image will be credited as an author in creation of the image. Artists whose work is used for creation of Sabian Symbol Image will receive a percentage of royalties from any future sales/commissions.

What I need

The resources needed for the launch of this project: support of the website, hard cost resources to create the images, production of original 12 high quality artistic print(s) and 12 sets of postcard(s). Web and print advertising, in addition to social media to promote awareness and participation of the project.

What you get

This is an exciting and ambitious project. Collectively, we will create an extraordinary experiment in the evolution of consciousness through a collaborative art project. All are welcome to participate in this project.

However, whether or not you choose to donate or participate in this project, you can participate in the evolution of consciousness. It really is quite simple; Kindness, Empathy and Compassion. Aspire to these qualities toward your fellow men, women, children, animals and Gaia herself.

About me

I am a graphic designer, fine artist, astrologer, and award-winning writer. I have studied Astrology for many years and have personally had some extraordinary experiences with the Sabian Symbols. I would love for the world to experience the extraordinary human and spiritual potential of the symbols. To bring the Sabian Symbols into visual existence has been a dream of mine for 12 years.

Please visit Sabian Art for more information about this project.

Thank you,

In love and light!

jody

story:
Fiestas Fridas is committed to taking Cultura deeper than Cinco de Mayo and Dia de los Muertos!

Did you know that Frida Kahlo spent a considerable amount of time in San Francisco?

*Aside from Mexico, New York City and Paris, San Francisco was one of her favorite places to be.
*She spent many days watching her husband, Diego Rivera, paint commissioned murals all over the Bay Area and many days visiting her doctor, whose practice was in San Francisco.
*A handful of Diego's murals exist in the San Francisco Bay (and other parts of Califas). A Diego Mural at SF City College has an image of Frida working on a painting. (It really is her painting; Diego insisted she paint the piece herself.)
*She created many pieces of art while inside the 7x7 (San Francisco is 49 square miles). Having been born in July, she loved the number 7!
*Emmy Lou Packard was a well-known San Francisco artist and photographer; she was one of Frida's favorite lover bois. They spent much time together in The City by the Bay and en La Casa Azul.
*In 1931, Frida's painting "Frieda and Diego Rivera" showed at the "Sixth Annual Exhibition of the San Francisco Society of Women Artists"-- the first public showing of her work.

*In 2013, La Comunidad de San Francisco celebrated Frida Kahlo's 103rd and 106th birthday with much song, dance, art and revelry. (She was born in 1907, but chose 1910 as her birth year in honor of the start of the Mexican Revolution). No one had ever seen so many Fridas in one place--outside of the city of Houston Texas. (They've been celebrating Frida for over 10 years now!)

Okay, we haven’t done it yet. Fiestas Fridas needs your help to make it so!

This inaugural event celebrates the Life of Frida Kahlo and her relationship with the San Francisco Bay Area. As the most Famous Mexican Artist of all time, her artistic expression of self, life, love and pain are universal themes that continue to impact artists worldwide.

We’ve planned three days of revelry in the heart of San Francisco's Mission District.

Friday July 5th, 2013

Mission Cultural Center Opening Gala Dinner (21+) 6pm to 11pm

Frida’s Fiestas Cookbook Dinner (Guadalupe Rivera)

  • San Francisco Restaurants make one of Frida Kahlo’s recipes for this Casa Azul kitchen inspired dinner (Puerto Alegre, Gracias Madre, Green Chili Kitchen, Chili Pie Restaurant, La Casa de Chocolate and more.)
  • Beverages provided by Tequila Don Pilar and others.
  • Dj Rosa la Rumorosa, Mariachi Femenil Orgullo Mexicano, Live Art by Bay Area artists, Face Painting for Adults, Pop-up Bookstore, Frida Vendors.

 

Saturday July 6th

Victoria Theater Film/Performance Evening 5pm to 11 pm

  • “The Life and Death of Frida Kahlo as told to David and Karen Crommie” of San Francisco, 1966 Documentary
  • “Frida – Naturaleza Viva” The original Frida Movie. 1984 in Spanish Featuring Ofelia Medina.
  • Performers Showcase featuring Live Music, Dancers and Performance Pieces by Local Artists.
  • Beer & Wine, Concession Stand
  • Local Food Vendors stationed just outside the venue

 

Sunday July 7th

Women’s Building Community Event 2pm to 9 pm

Auditorium

  • DJ Anthony Valadez (KCRW Los Angeles) Frida inspired World Music Set
  • DJ Rosa La Rumorosa Salsa & Latin Music Set
  • Live Art, Performers, Dancers & Music on the main stage
  • Local artists and vendors of Frida inspired art
  • Frida Raffle featuring Restaurant Gift Certificates, Signed Bottle of Tequila Don Pilar, Fossil Calavera Watch and more
  • Community Costume Contest - Best Frida, Best Frido (dressed like a boy), Best Fridita (kids), Best FriDrag, Best Frita (Funny Frida), Best Diego and Best Diegito

Audre Lorde Room

  • Curated Art Exhibit of FFSF Participating Artists
  • Wine, Beer, Snack Area
  • Art Vendor Area, Pop-up Bookstore
  • Face Painting 

Side room

  • pARTicipation craft stations. Frida inspired art for adults

Children's room

  • pARTicipation craft area for kids sponsored by La Plazita Preschool 2pm to  6pm

Pasaporte Frida - Ongoing Various locations

After the party is over, take the Pasaporte Frida out on a tour of local businesses. Patronize and spend some cash at our participating restaurants, donors, and retailers before the end of 2013. Return the Pasaporte to FFSF and receive a 2014 calendar and/or an FFSF T-shirt featuring the Frida inspired art from this inaugural event. We will send your completed Pasaporte back to you and you will qualify for cool treats and discounts at future Fiestas Fridas Events.

We need your support to bring you some Califas Cultura!

  1. Fiestas Fridas San Francisco website $500
  2. Marketing Materials Design (flyers, FFSF stickers, exhibit posters & mini posters, gift certificates, calendar, gala dinner recipe/sponsor cards, logo, Pasaporte Frida & Pasaporte Proof of Patronage Stickers) $350
  3. Printing of above listed marketing materials $1000
  4. Mission Cultural Center (space rental, sound equipment, tables, chairs, clean up, 1 DJ (3 hours), Mariachi Femenil Orgullo Mexicano (2 hours), liquor license (beer, wine & tequila) $3000
  5. Victoria Theater (space rental, insurance, 1 time public showing rights of 1 documentary and 1 full length feature film, liquor license (beer & wine), sound technician) $2500
  6. Women's Building (space rental, stage, tables, sound technician, 2 DJs & equipment, liquor license (beer & wine), sound technician $2500

For your contribution, every one of our FFSF funding levels comes with an FFSF gift made specifically for Frida's 103rd and 106th Birthday Celebration in San Francisco.

***No funds to share with us, no problem. We'll still share with you! We need volunteers! Like our Facebook page and offer your services for part or all of the event.***

Tickets will be available for purchase on June 7th, check our Facebook page for more info.

Mil Gracias in advance!

Fiestas Fridas San Francisco.

A huge thank you to Chloe Rose for the Frida Fashions, Ninette Lewis for the artwork, Jean Equality Franco for an amazing Frida, Laura Salazar, Cori Pillows and Michelle Olvera.

Please like our Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/FiestasFridasSanFrancisco

Pasaporte Frida - Ongoing Various locations
After the party is over, take the Pasaporte Frida out on a tour of local businesses. Patronize and spend some cash at our participating restaurants, donors, and retailers before the end of 2013. Return the Pasaporte to FFSF and receive a 2014 calendar and/or an FFSF T-shirt featuring the Frida inspired art from this inaugural event. We will send your completed Pasaporte back to you and you will qualify for cool treats and discounts at future Fiestas Fridas Events.
We need your support to bring you some Califas Cultura!

Fiestas Fridas San Francisco website $500
Marketing Materials Design (flyers, FFSF stickers, exhibit posters & mini posters, gift certificates, calendar, gala dinner recipe/sponsor cards, logo, Pasaporte Frida & Pasaporte Proof of Patronage Stickers) $350
Printing of above listed marketing materials $1000
Mission Cultural Center (space rental, sound equipment, tables, chairs, clean up, 1 DJ (3 hours), Mariachi Femenil Orgullo Mexicano (2 hours), liquor license (beer, wine & tequila) $3000
Victoria Theater (space rental, insurance, 1 time public showing rights of 1 documentary and 1 full length feature film, liquor license (beer & wine), sound technician) $2500
Women's Building (space rental, stage, tables, sound technician, 2 DJs & equipment, liquor license (beer & wine), sound technician $2500
For your contribution, every one of our FFSF funding levels comes with an FFSF gift made specifically for Frida's 103rd and 106th Birthday Celebration in San Francisco.
***No funds to share with us, no problem. We'll still share with you! We need volunteers! Like our Facebook page and offer your services for part or all of the event.***
Tickets will be available for purchase on June 7th, check our Facebook page for more info.
Mil Gracias in advance!
Fiestas Fridas San Francisco.
A huge thank you to Chloe Rose for the Frida Fashions, Ninette Lewis for the artwork, Jean Equality Franco for an amazing Frida, Laura Salazar, Cori Pillows and Michelle Olvera.
Please like our Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/FiestasFridasSanFrancisco

story:
How to Contribute via PayPal without a PayPal Account

Why to donate for the Kalamata Street Festival? 3 reasons;

1. It is a non-commercial, 100% volunteer international festival with free entrance but yet offering more than 20 parallel activities!

2. Your donation will offer the opportunity to more young artists from all around the world to present their work in front of 10,000 people!

3. You will help the Kalamata Street Festival to become more sustainable, to carry on its great community and youth work and prove that nothing is impossible! 

Be Part of the 8th Kalamata Street Festival! Support the activity which changes our perception for festivals!!!

The Kalamata Street Festival is an international, voluntary, non-commercial festival, which aims to offer the open space to young artists and athletes to present and promote their work. It is a broader co-organisation of several local associations, organisations and informal groups with the coordination of the Youth Centre of Kalamata and the youth organization K.A.NE.. It is a non-political, non-religious festival based 100% on volunteerism with free entrance, self-funded and DIY. Our motivation to initiate it, 5 years ago, was the passion to make the difference, the will to make the change and the need to create something, which we will all enjoy!

What happened through these years? We enjoyed a lot, we got even more passionate, we got even more motivated! The same goes for another 7000 visitors who attended the festival last year… and the festival grows bigger, grows international, grows better!!! But in parallel the needs are growing… and at this moment we need YOU, your support, your contribution!!! Be part of our team and support one unique cause; the sustainability of one great event!

By supporting the 8th Kalamata Street Festival, you support the young artists, the young athletes, the cooperation between the organizations of the community, the graffiti artists who cannot express their art because they are considered vandals, the skaters who are kicked out of the neighborhood because they were making noise, the youth groups who don’t have the capacity to present their work to the public.

By supporting the 8th Kalamata Street Festival you support the DIY activities and you prove wrong, all those who believe that everything in life should be commercial. You prove wrong all those who believe that with low budget you cannot do something big.

Well… the Kalamata Street Festival is a very low budget festival but in parallel it offers quality and quantity. It offers 10 to 20 parallel activities. Theatre, dance, concerts, graffiti, art exhibitions, movie projections, sport activities (skates, dirt-bikes, basketball, volleyball, inline, climbing), workshops, presentations and many more.

How do we manage all these? We put our passion in action and we are having the assistance of beautiful people, like you!

THE SUPPORT WE ASK:

As we previously referred the Kalamata Street Festival has a free entrance policy but at the same time it hosts many artists from all over Greece and Europe. Also having 10-20 parallel events, means that needs are increasing.  The main expense is artists travel expenses and accommodation.

With your help we can raise 3000€ that we need in order to make this festival was it deserves and give as more opportunities as we can to as more young artists as we can… The support that we are asking from you, is a small donation and to help us with the dissemination of our event to entities of artistic and cultural nature in our country.

According to your donation, we have some small “presents” for you. Support us and get from a personalised photo collection to a full “festival’s box” and your name at the sponsors’ page.

The Impact

The Kalamata Street Festival is quite an important event as it offers the open space to the youth. It boosts their creativity and promotes their work. It is establishing new partnerships between organisations and artists. It treats every participant equally and promotes the cultural creation. It is an open experiment and belongs to the community. The international character of the festival is having a big impact to the local community, multiculturalism, exchange of good practices, new ideas born during the festival and all these through great fun!

We will not speak about any theoretical impact, which this festival might have, we we’ll speak about the results of the previous ones…

-  an informal network of associations, civil organisations and public organisations was created in our small city

-  hundreds of people got motivated to participate and become active volunteers of the festival

-  many people “met” their art or the most suitable for them organisation, their new friend or the love of their lives!

-  more than 40 active organisations are involved one way or the other

-  more than 7000 people attended last year

-  more than 100 international volunteers and artists participated last year

-  many artists formed their own organisations, informal groups, associations after meeting people with the same motivation in the festival. 3 associations were created, 4 informal youth groups and 1 cultural business idea were born in through the festival

-  more than 15 artists from all over Europe came last year, with their own expenses just to participate to this unique event. This year already 50 artists from abroad expressed their interest to participate.

-  more than 15000 people attended or actively participated to the previous festivals [NOTE: Kalamata is a small city of 60,000 citizens and 250 km far from Athens].

Other Ways You Can Help

You got no penny in the pocket? Neither do we! We fully understand. But you can help us with many other ways:

  1. Promote this event to as many friends you can
  2. Like and Promote our facebook page
  3. Follow and promote our Twitter
  4. Follow and promote our Youtube channel
  5. Come to Kalamata this summer and volunteer for the Festival!!!!!
  6. Send us your positive energy!

Other Ways You Can Help
You got no penny in the pocket? Neither do we! We fully understand. But you can help us with many other ways:


Promote this event to as many friends you can

story:
Badger Studios has been covering conventions and charity events since 2011. However due to financial hardships, the Studios has had to cut back on  growth and much needed equipment upgrades.

Badger Studios has always striven to bring top quality convention coverage to fans at no cost since its creation. However, that has become increasingly more difficult, especially with limited resources and equipment.

Due to the generosity of a long time patron, Badger Studios will be able to attend DragonCon 2014 this year! However, the Studios still needs your help to provide adequate coverage of this convention!

In order to provide better coverage of events, the Studios needs a major equipment overhaul. (Additional lights, batteries, lenses, etc.) This is where you come in.

Every contributor will receive a one on one photo shoot with Badger Studios! So yes, even if you fund $1, that will still get you a one on one photo shoot! (The only stipulation is that we both have to be at the same place at the same time.)

So please, help a struggling studio continue to grow by getting us the equipment we need! Spunk has gotten Badger Studios this far, your generous support will help us on the next leg of our journey! 

Badger Studios has a strong belief in capturing the amazing events that happen at conventions all over the country! We do not limit our studio to any one type of person or costume or genre...you know what we mean! So thank you very much for helping us continue onward!

story:
There has been an effort over the past year to raise private funds in order to renovate the stadium at Independence High School. The goal in mind is to raise enough funds to transform the current grass field into a turf surface. The change will not only positively impact the athletic teams and marching band that use it, but it will also provide an enhancement to our school district, city, and residents that use it. 

Recently, there has been a new approach to donations called The 333 Club-- a three year commitment to contribute $333 to the fund. With being young in our careers/finishing up school, I know that a large donation at this point is somewhat unrealistic. Therefore, my hope is that we can make a large donation together on behalf of the class of 2006, 2007, and 2008.

My ultimate goal would be to reach $1000, which is the total contribution of The 333 Club over the next 3 years. ANY amount that you could contribute is so appreciated. 

Thank you so much for your support. Go devils!

story:
Since its establishment in 2004, the Galicia Jewish Museum has become one of the most important institutions commemorating the Jewish past, and has taken part in the revival of Jewish life in contemporary Poland. The Museum is located in Kazimierz, the old Jewish district of Kraków. It’s an ideal place for learning not only about Jewish life of the past, but also the continuation of Jewish presence in this part of the world despite of the horrors of the Holocaust.

There is no other Jewish museum in Central and Eastern Europe of a comparable size that is as innovative as the Galicia Jewish Museum in terms of its position vis-à-vis exhibiting Jewish culture, the Holocaust, and present-day Jewish life all under one roof.

Within the last ten years we were visited by more than 300,000 people from around the world. In 2014 alone, the Museum hosted over 800 educational events, and in addition over 200 cultural and artistic events. This makes us one of the most actively didactic Jewish institutions in Poland.

Our current space, which proved sufficient for the first few years of the Museum’s activity, today increasingly limits the operations of the institution. For this reason, the Museum has just signed an agreement to acquire additional space. Thanks to this expansion, the Museum area will increase by over fifty-percent!

Unfortunately, this new space is in extremely poor condition, badly needing a renovation, and must be properly equipped in order for it to be operational.

So far we have managed to secure over 60% of the required funds. Thanks to that, work will begin soon. However, to finish this project, we need your support! 

Become part of this new and exciting project which will define the future of the Galicia Jewish Museum! 

About the project

The Galicia Jewish Museum is a thriving institution. Thanks to its unique exhibition programme, as well as the various cultural, artistic, and educational activities it houses, the Museum has seen a rapid rise in visitor turnout. In the past five years, the Museum’s visitor numbers increased by over 90%. At the same time, the number of guided museum tours has increased by over 70%.

The increasing number of visitors, as well as the comprehensive development of our events, educational programmes, and other activities, has been limited in recent years by our insufficient amount of space. The Museum serves as a host to and main cooperant of an ever-increasing number of happenings which occupy the Museum in a way that, if subject to reservation by a group or for a cultural event, is used to the exclusion of the main expositional and educational purposes for visitors to the Museum. In many cases, the Museum has faced the choice to either continue to contribute to Krakow’s contemporary cultural life and local Jewish community by offering its area, or to consign its spatial resources for the benefit of the visitors and the narrative of the exhibition.

The prospect of expanding the Museum will provide the opportunity to create a separate space to host events, and to give proper attention to our temporary exhibition programme without disrupting the main function of the main hall as a space first and foremost for the Traces of Memory core exhibition. As a result, the Museum will not only further develop and boost its visitor turnout, but will most of all augment the Museum's ability to build an open, multicultural society free of intolerance.

New space

The new space is located in a lot bordering the Museum, and it has a unique, post-industrial character which will perfectly harmonise with the current building. Originally a Jewish factory, after WWII it served many different purposes, and years of misuse and neglect left it in very poor shape, worsening with each and every year. With this project, the Museum will not only ensure that a vital landmark of the Jewish urban fabric in Krakow will be properly preserved, but also that it will be used in the best possible way—teaching about the past it represents, and becoming part of the revival of Jewish life in Poland.

The new space will be adapted for two new exhibition spaces, an educational room, a concert/conference hall, and an office. The Museum will also gain a summer garden.

By becoming part of this project, you will not only help commemorate the history kept within the Museum. You will also be supporting an institution that takes an active role in the rebirth of Jewish life in Poland—an institution that continues to help build an open and tolerant society that is aware of its past, and actively shapes its Polish-Jewish future.


For USA tax-payers:
You can also make your donation through the Taube Foundation for Jewish Life & Culture (by check only). 

Make payable to:
Taube Foundation for Jewish Life & Culture
2150 Post Street
PO Box 159004
San Francisco, CA 94115

http://www.taubephilanthropies.org/

On the memo line of the check, please write “Galicia Jewish Museum”.

Please inform us about your payment: jakub@galiciajewishmuseum.org

All perks remain unchanged!

story:
Improvements are on the way.

Thanks for your interest in The Soap Factory. We're going to be making major improvements to the building very soon, and we look forward to working with you in the future to bring great art to the Twin Cities. Don't forget to check out tickets to our fall show, Unhinged, and become a member of The Soap Factory to keep in touch.

story:
"20 Years Later..."

I have a history of attending reunions...

 

 

While growing up in southern Wisconsin and southeastern Minnesota my family had annual summer reunions. My grandmother, Eleanor House, instilled (and for some, imposed) the importance of family gatherings. Inspired by my grandmother’s example I have organized a "family" reunion of the University of Tennessee - Knoxville Master of Fine Art Class of 1993 which I am proud to be a part of.

 

In 2012 I found my good friend, collaborator, fishing guide and fellow grad Scott Palmer on Facebook. I began wondering what the other Class of 1993 MFA grads were doing these days. After searching the Internet, using social media and with assistance from the UTK Alumni Office I was able to connect and encourage Scott Palmer, Annette Bongers, Laurie (Calhoun) Robichaux, Brad Cantrell, Kris (Rehring) Jones, Eric Smith, Melanie McLaughlin, Earl Watson, David Deitrick, Rob Tarbell, Debi (Henry) Danielson, Eric Fracassi and Melody Reeves to share current images, objects and ideas that represent their creative pursuits today.

 

The "20 Years Later..." exhibit, showing at the UT Downtown Gallery in Knoxville, TN August 2-24,2013, coincides with the beginning of the 2013-2014 UTK school year. New and returning students, graduate students, faculty, staff and alumni will have the opportunity to interact with a number of the MFA graduate alumni from '93. Like the Visiting Artist program the UT School of Art hosts each year, this will be a unique opportunity for the UT and Knoxville communities to see what fourteen MFA graduates are doing with their personal and professional lives today.

 

Organizing “20 Years Later…” has given me the opportunity to facilitate reconnection between people in this group. Like me, many have moved on and lost touch with each other but have not forgotten the connections created in the classrooms and studios we inhabited in the UTK Art and Architecture building from 1990 - 1993.

What We Need & What You Get

The UTK School of Art is funding the basic expenses related to hosting the exhibit. The funds you provide will be used for the following:

Defray the cost of shipping for artists who live outside Knoxville. Nine of the fourteen artists will have expenses related to shipping their work to the UT Downtown Gallery. Approx cost: $325

I will be travelling to Knoxville to coordinate the installallation of the exhibit. Transportation and expenses related to travel, food and lodging from Rochester, MN to Knoxville will be approx. $425.

Additional expenses for materials, supplies and misc. approx. $100

To entice potential donors I am offering a limited number of perks for each of the three donor levels:

  • Fresh Popped Kettle Korn House kettle corn
  • Collage postcards created by myself
  • A signed and framed exhibit poster from a 1970 show of work by at the Detriot Museum of Art
  • All contributors at any level will be mentioned in the "20 Years Later..." exhibit didactic materials.

Please help spread the word about this campaign

Not everyone can contribute money but everyone knows someone who may be able to. Crowd funding relies on people using their personal and professional networks to get the word out for events like "20 Years Later..."

  • Please share this campaign with anyone you feel may be supportive.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to easily and efficently connect people with our indiegogo campaign.

Thank You!

I will be travelling to Knoxville to coordinate the installallation of the exhibit. Transportation and expenses related to travel, food and lodging from Rochester, MN to Knoxville will be approx. $425.
Additional expenses for materials, supplies and misc. approx. $100
To entice potential donors I am offering a limited number of perks for each of the three donor levels:

Fresh Popped Kettle Korn House kettle corn
Collage postcards created by myself
A signed and framed exhibit poster from a 1970 show of work by at the Detriot Museum of Art
All contributors at any level will be mentioned in the "20 Years Later..." exhibit didactic materials.





Please help spread the word about this campaign
Not everyone can contribute money but everyone knows someone who may be able to. Crowd funding relies on people using their personal and professional networks to get the word out for events like "20 Years Later..."

Please share this campaign with anyone you feel may be supportive.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to easily and efficently connect people with our indiegogo campaign.


Thank You!

story:
Game of Sounds est un festival associatif né de la volonté commune de plusieurs jeunes aveyronnais portés par des valeurs alternatives, une envie de partage et le goût pour la musique et les arts en général.

L'organisation est aujourd'hui structurée autour d'une équipe d'amis soudée par le désir de proposer une autre façon d'envisager la création et l'expression, par des manifestations à échelle humaine, sans structure pyramidale, sans têtes d'affiches et sans OGM !

La troisième édition se déroulera les 28 et 29 août prochains sur le plateau du Larzac, et nous avons besoin du financement des festivaliers afin de rester dans cette dynamique indépendante !

Nous avons besoin d'argent pour louer une sono ainsi que des lumières dignes de ce nom, faire venir tous les artistes, musiciens et circaciens (la programmation a encore fait un bond en avant cette année !)... Il nous faudra notamment mettre en place un système électrique aux normes, au milieu d'un champ vierge de tout !

Nous avons fixé des récompenses qui permettent tout simplement l'obtention des pass pour les deux jours du festival. Les dons supérieurs ont été établis afin de marquer le soutien au festival, et sont donc symboliques.

Game of Sounds, c'est nous qui l'organisons, c'est vous qui permettrez de le réaliser et de nous faire passer un week-end génial dans un cadre fantastique !
